loans.name: Andrea Xiomara

texts.es: Andrea Xiomara Hernández Martínez tiene  de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues el único medio de vida que tiene para sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son lo más importante que tiene en su vida. Ella se levanta todos los días a las 4 de la madrugada para alistar en bolso sus productos y venderlos a sus clientes que hacen posible que su actividad económica mejore. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Andrea Xiomara Hernández Martínez sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over four years. It is the only way of life she has to get her three children ahead. They are the most important thing she has in her life. She gets up everyday at four in the morning to arrange her products in a bag and sell them to her customers. They make it possible for her economic activity to improve. She is asking for the loan for working capital to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Reynaldo R. T. tiene 29 años, el señor  Reynaldo se dedica a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases de productos lácteos, y acude por las noches a la universidad donde está a menos de medio año de graduarse de la carrera de Veterinaria, que él asegura que le dará buenos ingresos por que en la zona donde vive no hay un veterinario cerca.

El señor Reynaldo  vive en la zona de Machac Marca en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que tienen su ganado no es muy bueno que a la mayoría les falta establos que en esta época de lluvia son muy requeridos por tanto el señor Reynaldo  utilizara este crédito para construir su establo y que sus vacas no sufran en la época de lluvia. 

El señor Reynaldo  nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como siempre lo hizo, terminar su carrera y ser el mejor veterinario que pueda y de esta manera no solo ganar dinero si no también dar un servicio necesario a la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo R. T. is 29 years old and raises dairy cows for milk production. He sells the milk to a company that produces all types of dairy products. At night he attends classes at the university, where he is six months away from earning his degree in veterinary medicine. He says that he should be able to earn a good income because there are no veterinarians available who live in the nearby areas.

Sr. Reynaldo lives in the district of Machac Marca in Cochabamba. It is a fairly remote area of the city, so it is difficult for him to go to a bank in order to obtain a loan. For this reason, CIDRE took the initiative to come to this area. He says his cows are in bad shape because he lacks a stable to shelter them during the rainy season. With this loan, he will build a stable so that his cows are protected from the rain.

Sr. Reynaldo says his biggest dreams are to continue being a dairy farmer and to finish his degree. He wants to become the best veterinarian who can, not only make money, but also provide a needed service to his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable

loans.name: Ayda Lina

texts.es: La señora Ayda Lina tiene 55 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos mayores de edad. La señora tiene una mini tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual además de vender vestuario también vende zapatos, joyas, ropa de niño, etc. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 12 años, primeramente su mama tenía una pulpería y fue la que la indujo a tener su negocio propio, ya que a través de ese negocio la señora mantenía a sus hijos. Allí fue que la señora se armó de valor y empezó a vender primeramente ropa al crédito, por encargo y poco a poco se fue haciendo de un inventario grande. Comentaba la señora que a pesar de la crisis económica sufrida por el país, no le ha afectado tanto ya que de un tiempo para acá empezó a vender solamente a contado y no a crédito y pese a que ella tiene bastante clientela ha logrado mantener el volumen de sus ventas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  mayor cantidad de mercancías para surtir más el negocio ahora que se acerca la época navideña. Su meta siempre ha sido construir un local más grande y apropiado para su negocio, ya que actualmente utiliza la sala de su casa.
texts.en:
Ayda Lina is 55, married, and has four adult children. She has a mini store, which is located in her house. Besides selling clothing, she also sells shoes, jewelry, and children’s clothes, etc. She started this business 12 years ago. First, her mother had a mini market. She was the one who introduced her to having her own business. The woman supported her children through this business. That is where, armed with courage, she started to sell primarily clothes by order on credit. Little by little she was getting a large inventory. She says that in spite of the economic crisis that the country has suffered, it has not affected her so much. A while back she started selling for cash only, no credit. Because she has plenty of customers, she has been able to maintain her volume of sales. The loan is to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her business more now that the Christmas season is getting closer. Her goal has always been to build a larger and more appropriate place for her business. She currently uses the living room of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es: La señora Silvia tiene 42 años, es casada y posee cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad. La señora tiene 23 años de dedicarse a la venta de cítricos y perecederos en los departamentos del país. Ella tiene una camioneta en la cual salen a vender ella y su esposo. Ella ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con nosotros, los cuales le han enseñado a ser responsable ya que su actividad depende en gran parte de mantener un buen record crediticio. Ha pagado a la fecha todas sus cuotas en tiempo y forma, ella nos dice que recoge con anticipación para el pago de la cuota. De hecho le ha ayudado bastante el financiamiento ya que le ha permitido invertir es por eso que solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así invertir en su negocio. Su sueño con respecto al futuro sigue siendo el mismo: llegar a comprar una vivienda propia ya que aun tiene que andar alquilando.
texts.en:
Silvia is 42, married and has four adult children. She has been involved in the sale of citrus and other produce in areas of the country for 23 years. She has a truck in which her and her husband go out to sell. She has had four loans through us, which have taught her to be responsible since her business activity depends in part to maintaining a good credit record. She is up to date with all of her payments, and mentions that she tries to collect in advance to cover the payment. The financing has been very helpful because it has allowed her to invest in her business, reason why she requests a loan to have working capital for the business. Her dream for the future hasn’t changed: be able to purchase a house, since she is currently renting.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca tiene 57 años de edad es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de manualidades, por lo que tiene más de 4 años de tener esta actividad, ya que surgió como una alternativa de trabajo para ella y su familia por lo que su salario no le ajusta para pagar las deudas del hogar. Por lo que es por medio de Fundación León 2000 que ha logrado obtener estos financiamientos que hacen que su negocio mejore cada día. El sueño de Juana es mantener seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. Por lo que el financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que tiene muchos encargos pendientes y no ha podido entregarlos porque no tiene el suficiente capital.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca, 57, is a very enterprising woman who takes pleasure in her work. She makes and sells handicrafts, a job at which she has more than four years of experience ever since it became her and her family's alternative to her job for as her salary wasn't enough to meet the debt she owed on her home. Through the Fundación León 2000 she has been able to receive loans that improve her business day by day. Juana hopes that she will continue operating her business now that it is the only way of life that she has. This loan will be used for working capital since she has many pending orders that she has not been able to fill due to a lack of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daissy Ivonne

texts.es:
La Señora Daissy Ivonne M. A., ella tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, es el primer créditos que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento,piedras,etc. para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en la  vivienda en la que habita, esto es para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Daissy Ivonne Martinez A. is married and has three children, two that are in school. This is the first loan that she has taken with CEPRODEL. She has invested what CEPRODEL has lent her in improving the condition of her home. The loan that she asked for is to buy construction materials such as: iron, zinc, cement, stones, etc to build a bedroom in the family’s house. This will improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano es un señor de 34 años está casado y tiene 3 hermosos  hijos de (6,3 y 1) años, don Feliciano estuvo en España 3 años trabajado y logro reunir lo suficiente para comprarse un vehículo (trufi) y de esta manera ingresar a un sindicato de transporte y ahora trabaja en el servicio de transporte público y de esta manera por lo menos tiene un trabajo estable. Son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, no tienen una casa propia viven en una casa en alquiler con solo un cuarto, donde vive toda la familia y tienen que darse modos para que estén cómodos todos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de un terreno para la construcción de su casa propia  y de esta manera puedan dejar de vivir tan incómodos en un solo cuarto.

El sueño primordial es construir su propia casa, ponerle un buen negocio a su esposa y que sus hijos estudien para que en un futuro puedan tener una carrera profesional y de esta manera tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a 34-year-old man who is married with three beautiful children who are 1, 3, and 6 years old. While working in Spain for three years, he was able to save enough to buy himself a vehicle (a trufi, or minibus) that enabled him to become part of a transportation union. Now he works in the public transportation sector, which at least provides him with steady work. His family has few economic resources; they have no home of their own and live in a rented house with only one room. The whole family lives together and must take pains to be polite to ensure everyone's comfort. The loan is intended for the purchase of a plot of land for the construction of their own home; this way they will no longer have to live in such an uncomfortable situation in a single room. Feliciano's dearest wish is to build his own home, establish a good business for his wife's benefit, and to help his children study so that they can have professional careers that will improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase land to build a home

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea se dedica una pulpería desde hace mucho tiempo a esta actividad económica, como es la compra y venta de ropa por lo que le gusta mucho su actividad económica pues disfruta mucho de comunicarse con sus clientes y además le gusta viajar a comprar los productos necesarios que sus clientes le solicitan. Con el apoyo de su esposo se siente muy apoyada ya que tiene que ir al mercado en busca de sus productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica que es la fuente ingresos necesarios para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Andrea has worked in a general store for a long time. What she likes about her business is the buying and selling of clothes. She enjoys talking with her customers, and also traveling to buy the necessary products that her customers want. With her husband’s support, she feels very comfortable since she has to go to the market to find the merchandise. She is asking for this loan for capital for her work. It will be used to buy candy, natural drinks, bread, cookies, etc. Her wish is to keep this business going so that she has the income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Florencia Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene 58 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 son jóvenes e independientes, son D. una familia D. escasos recursos económicos, por tal motivo ninguno D. sus hijos han estudiado una carrera profesional  llegando a estudiar solamente hasta la primaria  y ahora se dedican a trabajar, solo el hijo menor está estudiando en secundaria.

Doña Martha se dedica a la producción D. la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 6 cabezas D. ganado lechero y cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedican a elaborar diferentes productos lácteos.
El préstamo será destinado para la construcción D. un establo, lo cual es muy importante para la protección D. su ganado, ahora que empieza la temporada D. la lluvia.

Entre sus metas y sueños D. Doña Martha es aumentar la cantidad D. producción D. leche y que su hijo menor por lo menos sea el único D. los hijos que pueda estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is 58 years old and married. Of her four children, three are young independent adults. She comes from a low-income family, which is why none of her children have pursued professional degrees. The older children completed only elementary school before entering the workforce. Her youngest child is currently attending high school.

Doña Martha engages in raw milk production. She currently has six dairy cows and delivers their output to a company that makes different types of dairy products.

This loan will be used to build a stable, which is very important for sheltering her cows since the rainy season has already started. Among her goals and dreams are increasing her milk production and supporting her youngest child who is capable of pursuing a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
el grupo el nuevo Esfuerzo esta integrado por 3 hombres los cuales son muy trabajadores, tienen mucho tiempo de conocerce, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:

JUAN ANTONIO C., es el jefe del grupo, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tuvo 3 hijos en su matrimonio, actualmente el cuenta con un molino para moler maiz, este lo tieen ubicado en su casa de habitacion, atiende en horas de la madrugada ya que el tambien se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañileria despues lo queda atendiendo su esposa, ellos son un matrimonio bien establecido y gracias a los ingresos del molino ellos han sacado a adelante a su familia. ahora el esta solicitando  el credito para mejorar la caseta en donde esta el molino.


ELIAS ANTONIO C. es comerciante, cuenta con un molino para moler maiz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividiad y gracias a estos ingresos el puede cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos,  es importante decir que el señor C. sufrio un accidente en una maquina cuando el  trabajaba  para una fabrica de elaboracion de cajas para empacar Puros, la que le corto cuatro dedos de su mano derecha, fue ahi cuando el sintio la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingresos ya que no podia seguir trabajando en dicho lugar y hasta el momento el sostiene a su familia, tiene 4 hijos los que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado graduar y otros estan estudiando, actualmente el necesita comprar unos repuestos para el molino.

ESTEBAN S. su actividad principal es la venta de helados de diferentes sabores, vende conos en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Danli, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante  en una bicicleta, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad que le genera ingresos para cubrir  sus compromisos y gastos familiares, tiene 5 hijos que ya estan casados.
El junto con su esposa siempre siguen luchando por salir adelante, actualmente el solicita un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio.

todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Esfuerzo group is made up of 3 hard working men. Below are details of their different activities they do to earn a living:

Juan Antionio Colindre is the leader of the group. He is 64 years old, married and has three children from his marriage. He grinds corn and has a corn grinder in this house. He starts work hours before daybreak despite the fact that he also works as a mason laying bricks while his wife continues with the grinder. Their marriage is very stable and thanks to the income from the grinder, their family has moved ahead. They are now requesting a loan to improve the stand the grinder sits on.

Elias Antonio C. is a store keeper who uses a grinder to mill corn. His business is located at his home and has been working in this type of business for 8 years. Thanks to his income he has been able to cover his families costs and other obligations. It should be noted that Senor C. suffered an accident on a machine while he was working for box manufacturing factory packing Puros. He cut four fingers on his right hand and it was there he felt it was time to look for another source of income as he couldn’t continue working there. Until now, he has supported his wife and 4 children, some of whom, with lots of sacrifice, have managed to graduate and others who are still studying. He needs to replace his corn grinder.

Esteban S.’s income generating activity is selling different flavor ice creams. He sells his cones in different neighborhoods and districts around Danli. He sells ice cream using his bike. He has been selling ice cream for many years and has made money to cover his household costs and financial obligations. He has 5 children that are married. Together with his wife they are always striving to move forward. He is requesting a loan to supply more in his business.

They all need credit so they can move forward with their business.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream, cones, napkins, blocks, concrete, zinc, and replace a corn grinder

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Angel R. tiene un molino para moler maiz y tambien vende leña, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad es soltero y padre de 1 hija la cual ya esta casada.
Santos se levanta muy temprano para moler maiz a muchas personas que se dedican a la venta dde tortillas y otras para consumo en el hogar.
Santos necesita el credito para invertirlo en compra de leña, maiz y repuestos de su molino. Esto le permitira un mejor rendimiento y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  logrando por consiguiente mejores ingresos que le permitiran mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Senor Santos Angel R. has a mill to grind corn and also sells firewood; he has had this business for over 4 years. He is single and is the father of a daughter who is married. Santos gets up very early to grind the corn for many people who are in the business of selling tortillas and other items for home consumption. Santos needs a loan to invest in the purchase of firewood, corn and spare parts for his mill. This will allow him to increase his production and in this way provide a better service to his customers, thus achieving an increased income that will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the mill and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María tiene sesenta y dos años D. edad y está casada hace como cuarenta años con el señor Gabriel F. toda la vida han estado acostumbrados al trabajo D. campo. Ambos viven en la zona D. Maica Chica en la Ciudad D. Cochabamba.

La señora María  se dedica a la producción D. leche, ella dice que a la edad que tienen no quieren depender D. sus hijos que a ella su madre le enseño que tiene que trabajar hasta el ultimo día D. su vida es por esa razón que la señora María no acepta que sus hijos que son mayores le ayuden. La señora María es muy independiente junto con don Gabriel que están trabajando desD. muy temprano en orD.ñar a las vacas y en dar su alimento en su hora y María entrega la leche mientras el esposo esta siempre pendientes D. las vacas y D. las cosechas D. alfa.

El crédito que ella requiere es para la compra D. un camión D. Soya para la alimentación D. las vacas ya que ahora bajo D. precio y D. esa manera se proveerá para los siguientes meses y les dará  una mejor alimentación a sus vacas. La señora María colabora con la educación D. uno D. sus nietos porque el niño no tiene padre ya que a su hija la abandono con el niño. La señora María es una mujer muy responsable y humilD..
texts.en:
Señora María is 72 years old, and has been married for 40 years to the Señor Gabriel F.; all of their lives they have been accustomed to working on a farm. They both live in the Maica Chica zone of the city of Cochabamba. Señora María produces milk; she says that at their age they do not want to be dependent upon their children. Her mother taught her that one must work until the last day of one's life, and this is the reason that Señora María does not accept help from her adult children. Señora María is very independent along with her husband Don Gabriel. They work from very early in the morning to milk the cows and give them their food, and Maria delivers the milk while her husband is attends to the cows and the alfalfa crops. The loan that she requests is to buy a truckload of Soya to feed the cows, since right now the price is low and in this way she can stock up for the coming months and will be able to give better feed to her cows. Señora María helps out with the education of one of her grandchildren because the child does not have a father, since he abandoned her when she was a baby. Señora María is a very responsible and humble woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for the milk cows (SOYA )

loans.name: Lila Margarita

texts.es:
la sra. Lila Margarita A. tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, es madre soltera, su negocio le genera ingresos para el sustento de su hogar, Lila necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y necesita tener su negocio con bastente producto.
con las ganancias que tenga piensa ir remodelando poco a poco su negocio para darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes y hacerlo mas grande para poder tener mas mercaderia en el.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos. Lila es una persona muy amable y simpatica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lila Margarita A. is 29 years old, a single mother, and makes her living running a store. She has a small grocery located in her home. Her business generates her household income. Lila needs the loan in order to be able increase her business's supplies, since the needs of her customers are great and her business needs to have plenty of products. With her earnings, she is considering remodeling her store, little by little, in order to better serve her customers as well as making the store bigger in order to have more merchandise in it. This is her only source of income. Lila is a very friendly and nice person.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, rice, coffee, beans, bread, sodas, canned goods, cheeses, butter, juices, soups, balls, confections

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
el sr. RAUL ALBERTO G.,  Es comerciante, su actividad principal es la venta de muebles de hierro, electrodomesticos y ropa para cama, este producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Danli y comunidades Vecinas,  cuenta con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad
ya que el inicio en este negocio como vendedor de una distribuidora de estos productos y gracias a Dios y al apoyo que se le ha brindado el cuenta con su propio negocio, que le genera ingresos para hacerle frente a los compromisos y gastos de su familia.  es casado y tiene 2 hijos, que estan cursando la educacion primaria. actualmente solicita un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes varidadad de productos tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Raul Alberto is a businessman. His main business is selling iron furniture, electronic household appliances and bed sheets. He sells these items as a door-to-door salesman in the city of Danli and the neighboring communities. He has a lot of experience in this type of business. He started in this business as a salesperson for a distributor of these products. Thanks to God and with his own business earnings, he has been able to generate enough income to cover his liabilities and family expenses. He is married and has two children. The children are studying in primary school. He is asking for this loan in order to expand his business. In this way he will be able to offer his customers a greater variety of products since the Christmas season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron furniture for living rooms, kitchens and bath rooms. To buy bed sheets and household electronics.

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo por los que siempre ha luchado. Hace más de 31 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras. Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita ya que anteriormente ya había tenido una  buena experiencia  porque son muy importantes. Los inicios de su negocio se dan por que su Mama era quien se hacía cargo del negocio y se lo heredo a Hilda para que tuviera su propia fuente de ingreso. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de naranjas, mandarina, melones, repollo entre otros. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado esta actividad económica en donde interactúa con sus clientes. Ella sueña con ampliar cada día más su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Hilda is a single mother with two dependent children. She has always fought on their behalf. Hilda has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 31 years. This is not the first time she has applied for a loan, but she has had good experiences with her previous requests because the funding is very important to her.

Hilda’s mother passed this business on to her so that she could have her own source of income. The proceeds from this loan will be used to buy oranges, tangerines, melons, cabbages, and other types of produce. She likes this line of work because it requires frequent interaction with her customers. Hilda hopes to expand her business a bit more each day and provide her customers with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Christian Maykoll

texts.es:
El señor Christian tiene 29 años de edad él como primera actividad es técnico en veterinaria en la zona en la que vive. Ayuda y trabaja en la zona al mismo tiempo se dedica a la producción de leche.

El está acostumbrado al trabajo en el campo porque siempre desde niño ayudaba a su madre porque el padre los abandono cuando él era pequeño y  vive con ella y siempre está pendiente de su madre, Christian tiene un niño de tres años de edad el no está casado pero el niño vive con él y con su abuela que es la que lo cuida porque su madre trabaja como profesora en la ciudad y no puede hacerse cargo de él.

Con el crédito que solicita el comprara una vaca y construirá un establo para alojar ganado porque se viene la época de lluvia y el quiere darles mejor comodidad a sus vacas para que la producción de leche sea mejor. El es muy responsable a la actividad que se dedica la cual le gusta mucho.
En un futuro Christian quiere terminar la carrera de veterinario y de esa forma darle una mejor vida a su hijo y a su madre.
texts.en:
Mr. Christian is 29 years old. He works as a veterinary technologist in the area where he lives. At the same time he works in a dairy. He is used to working in the countryside because, since he was a child, he has helped his mother. His father abandoned his family when he was little. He lives with his mother and he has always lived with her. Christian has a three-year-old child. He is not married and his child lives with him and his mother. His mother takes care of the child because the child’s mother works as a teacher in the city and cannot care for the child. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy a cow and build a barn to house cattle. The rainy season is arriving. He would like his animals to be comfortable because when they are comfortable they produce more milk. He is a very responsible businessman and he enjoys his work. In the future, Christian would like to finish his veterinary studies and create a better life for his son and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and construct a barn to house his cattle.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA DEL CARMEN M. tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "MARY CARMEN" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene 4 años de tenerlo.
Maria es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales ya solo depende uno de su matrimonio  el otro ya se 
caso, su esposo se dedica al comercio tiene una agropecuaria y tambien es productor de café.
Doña CARMEN nos conto muy alegre que su negocio le ha sido de gran bendición, ya que con los 
ingresos que le ha generado el mismo, ha ido invirtiendo mas en su negocio y tambien cumpliendo con los compromisos adquiridos. ahora solicita el credito ya que necesita capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio porque se aproxima la temporada de mayor ventas y desea satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen M. has a small store that she operates under the name "MARY CARMEN." She has had this business, which is located in her house, for 4 years. Maria is married and is the mother of 2 children, of whom only one is still a dependent as the other is married. Her husband has a farming business and he is also a coffee producer. Doña Carmen tells us that she is very happy that her business has been a great blessing because of the income that it generates. She has been investing more in her business, and has fulfilled all of the commitments that she has entered into. Now she requests a loan because she needs working capital to stock her store, because we are approaching a peak sales season and she wants to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, cookies, churros, soft drinks, juices, condiments, soaps, batteries, razors, sanitary napkins, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 47 años de edad es agricultora y a la vez se dedica a la producción de leche, victoria es viuda tiene tres hijos que son pequeños. La mayor tiene 12 años el otro niño de 10 y el pequeño 7 años. Todos Viven el Zona de Machajmarca en la Ciudad de Cochabamba.

El esposo murió hace  tres años en un accidente en la carretera Santa Cruz - Cochabamba  en la empresa en la que trabaja no le dieron ninguna indemnización porque ellos justificaron que el señor se encontraba en estado de ebriedad y que el responsable era él, desde ese momento la señora Victoria es responsable de sus hijos ella se hace cargo de su educación  y trabaja mucho para  que los niños puedan terminar la escuela y poder estudiar alguna carrera como era el sueño del padre.

A la señora Victoria le sirve mucho el dinero que ella solicita porque ella comprara una vaca y aumentara su producción de leche y podrá tener un aumento en sus ingresos y podrá seguir ayudando a sus hijos. Ella no recibe ninguna ayuda solo es ella la que saldrá adelante con sus hijos y tratara de darles una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old. She is a farmer and works with the production of milk. Victoria is a widow with three small sons. The oldest is twelve years old, the next one is ten and the youngest is seven. They all live in the Machajmarca Zone in the city of Cochabamba. Her husband died three years ago in a car accident on the Santa Cruz – Cochabamba highway. The company he worked for gave him no death benefits because they claimed he was drunk and so was responsible for his own death. Since this time Mrs. Victoria has been responsible for her children. She is in charge of educating them and she works very hard so that her children can finish their schooling and study a career. That would be their father’s desire. Mrs. Victoria could really use the money that she is requesting. She will buy a cow and increase her milk production. This will increase her income, which will allow her to continue to help her children. Victoria does not receive any help. She is responsible for the progress of herself and her children. She is trying to provide them with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el señor Santos M. P. tiene 47 años de edad, es viudo, su esposa se murio hace unos dos meses, el vive con una sobrina y su hijo.
Santos se dedica a la venta de refrescos de cola al por mayor y al detalle tambien vende tarjetas y agua en fardos, sus ventas son diarias y le va muy bien. tiene dos años de tener este negocio y Santos tiene su propia casa.
esta solicitando un credito porque lo necesita para surtir de refrescos y tarjetas para esta navidad ya que es la epoca en donde las ventas son altas.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos M. Pavos is 47 years old. He is a recent widower since his wife passed away about two months ago. He lives with a niece and her son.

Santos sells cola at wholesale. In addition, he is a retailer of phone cards and cases of bottled water. His daily sales have been doing well. He manages his business from home and has been in operation for two years.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to restock his supply of soft drinks and phone cards for the Christmas season. His sales are higher during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & mobile phone calling cards

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 5 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Francisca, 26, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Francisca and the other borrowers live just north of San Pedro in Batey Victorina. Bateyes are small rural communities originally built by sugar companies to house their field workers. They lack potable water, reliable electricity, access to medical facilities, and many other amenities taken for granted in the developed world. Francisca lives with her husband and three children, ages three to seven, and currently is due to give birth next month! She runs a small business selling clothes to her friends and neighbors for extra income for her family. Francisca will use this loan, her fourth with Esperanza International, to purchase new jeans, blouses, and t-shirts to sell.

In addition to running her small business, Francisca also helps her sister with a hair salon. This gives her two jobs, and she is obviously also a full-time mother with one on the way. Francisca loves Esperanza, and is very grateful for the loan officers that she has worked with. She dreams to help her children with the profits from the loans, sending them all to get great educations. Francisca is also planning on adding on to her house, because currently she feels it is too small for her growing family. With your loan, Francisca will be one step closer to that dream. Thank you for lending to Francisca and the Cristo Redentor group!

loans.use: To purchase jeans, blouses, and t-shirts for resale

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia LUCRECIA es una humilde madre de familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente. La socia tiene tres hijos que estudian en el colegio, el mayor de los hijos es un niño especial es invidente. 

La socia Antonio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de repollos, culantro, zanahoria y muchas más, las verduras lo traen de las chacras del valle de Angostura. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar, con la venta de verduras.  Ya son  varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la venta y compra de aves de corral como gallinas y cuyes. Así de esta manera poder aumentar el capital del negocio y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a humble mother who has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 34 years old and in a common law marriage. Her three children attend high school. The oldest child is blind.

Lucrecia lives in the community of Angostura in San Jerónimo District, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She sells cabbages, cilantro, carrots, and many other types of produce. She brings in vegetables from her fields in the Valley of Angostura. Lucrecia divides her time between tending to her household duties and selling vegetables. She has several years of experience in this business and has done very well because of her efforts. Lucrecia is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy and sell chickens and guinea pigs. This will allow her to increase her business capital so that she can provide her children a better quality of life. Lucrecia is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & guinea pigs

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Doris Francisca Figuerioa tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Enrique Castillo, el es mesero profesional, dependen de ellos un hijo que esta estudiando para embarcarse.
 
Doris se dedica a la venta de golosinas por las tardes en su propio local y para esta navidad les va a dar una sorpresa a sus clientes ya que tiene pensado hacer otro tipo de comidas, sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares que viven en esta zona.
Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 08 años.
 
Doris esta solicitando un creedito para hacer algunos arreglos y detalles que le hacen falta
al nuevo local ademas para la compra de frescos, maseca, leña, verduras y carnes.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris Francisca F. is 51 years old and married to Sr. Jose Enrique Castillo, who is a professional waiter. They have a dependent child who is attending school.

Doris sells sweets in the afternoons out of her own shop. For the Christmas season, she plans to surprise her customers by offering other types of food. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and relatives who live in the area. She has been in this business for eight years.

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, cornmeal, firewood, vegetables, and meats. These items are needed to prepare the new dishes she plans to offer in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.en:
Gricelda is 21 years old; she lives with her partner, Juan Carlos, in the indigenous community of Suretka near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica.

Gricelda has a business selling merchandise in her community. She spends her days knocking on doors, offering various products such as perfumes, clothing, sandals, cosmetics and other household items to potential customers. She is a hardworking individual which is exhibited through her initiative to complete high school by attending night classes.

Gricelda is applying for a loan of 200,000 colons. With this loan she plans to purchase more products for sale and hopes to secure a better price from her suppliers through larger purchases. This will be her second loan with Fundacion Mujer; her first loan was paid back, on time and in full, in a short six months. This loan will enable her business to grow and take her closer to her dream of one day being able to open a store from where she could sell products, allowing her to travel less.

Gricelda’s main challenges are logistical. In order to purchase raw materials, she must travel to a town called Chasse. The town is not very far away, in absolute terms, but it is separated from Suretka by a large river. The river water travels at high speed which makes crossing dangerous, especially during the rainy season. Gricelda says that her main challenge is getting from her village, Suretka, to the location of her supplier, in Chasse. Buses are infrequent; Gricelda often ends up making the trip on foot which is a laborious task to say the least.

Indigenous rural areas such as Suretka are characterized by many difficulties such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education and lack of available financial services. Additionally, despite her entrepreneurial spirit, Gricelda´s efforts have been hamstrung due to her exclusion from the traditional banking system. This is where you, through Kiva’s lending model, can help. Your loan is a direct investment in the improvement of living conditions of a woman living in a poor Indigenous community of Caribbean Costa Rica. By lending to Gricelda, a proactive and hard working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to take the first steps on a path that leads to the end of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA es una humilde madre de familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 53 años de edad. La socia tiene cinco hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia tiene un taller de carpintería. Ella fabrica muebles de madera como escritorios, roperos, camas y sillas y también posee un carro que lo alquila para que de servicio de taxi. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar y con la ayuda que hace al taller de carpintería, ella laquea los muebles de madera. Ya son  varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en los materiales para el acabado de los muebles de madera que son importantes para este proceso como son el tiner, la laca, la pintura y muchos más. Ella dice ser una madre ejemplares que desde muy joven tenía que trabajar para llevar un pan a la boca de los hijos y considera que no dejaran de trabajar hasta que no le quede mas fuerzas para trabajar.    

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a humble mother who has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 53 years old and has 5 grown children who are independent.

Fortunata lives in the community of Angostura in San Jerónimo District, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a carpentry workshop where she makes wood furniture such as desks, wardrobes, beds, and chairs. In addition, she has a car that she rents out for taxi services. Fortunata divides her time between tending to her household duties and helping run the carpentry shop. She is responsible for applying lacquer to the wood furniture.

Fortunata has been in this business for several years and has done very well because of her efforts. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her family. This loan will be used to purchase materials that are important to the process of treating the finished furniture pieces such as thinner, lacquer, paint, and other products. Ever since she was young woman, Fortunata has tried to be an exemplary mother by working to feed her children. She never considered quitting and is determined to continue working until she no longer has the strength.

Fortunata is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thinners, lacquers, paints, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying foodstuffs and household goods

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA es una humilD. madre D. familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 57 años D. edad es casada y tiene 12 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. San Jerónimo en la comunidad D. Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur D. la ciudad del Cusco. La socia tiene un puesto D. venta en el paradero D. buses D. la comunidad D. Collana en Angostura. Ella prepara almuerzo para los chóferes y cobradores del paradero D. Angostura en San Jerónimo. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. comida. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar más platos D. comida. Ella dice ser una madre que no le teme a las adversidades y que seguirá luchando para ser feliz. Ella cuenta que tenia que trabajar mucho para llevar un pan a la boca para los doce hijos pues la situación era difícil pero con  la ayuda  D. los bancos comunales le va mejor.      

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fortuna is a humble mother who has belonged to the communal bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 57 years old, married, and has 12 children who are all older and on their own. She lives in the San Jerónimo district, in the Angostura neighborhood that is located south of Cusco. She has a stall at the Collana Angostura bus station where she makes lunch for the bus drivers and money collectors. She alternates between her home duties and her food sales. Fortuna has been at this for several years and it’s been going well thanks to all of the hard work she puts into her business. Our member is a hard working mother, and enterprising woman, who is helping her family to get ahead. She needs a loan to buy supplies to prepare more dishes. She says that she is a mother who is not afraid of adversity and will continue fighting to be happy. She tells us that she had to work hard to get enough bread to feed 12 children; it was a difficult situation, but it’s easier with help from the communal banks. The member is grateful for an opportunity like this and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs a loan to buy ingredients to prepare more plates of food.

loans.use: Fixing up his place

loans.use: The purchase of food goods
