She manages stiff competition and high transportation costs in this line of work. She is using this loan to buy more clothes to sell during the holiday season. Rose dreams of one day owning a dressmaking and tailoring shop. She is married with three children aged 4 to 11 years old, and very much wants to educate them to a higher level. Rose describes herself as selfless and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Leparan Colyne

texts.en: Leparan Colyne L. owns the Romosha Best transport services where he has two employees. He has run this business for two years, and transports passengers and traders to their various destinations at Keroka Ramasha route in Kisii town via a matatu (minibus).  His business challenge is the increased growing competition from similar businesses.  In addition to the matatu business, Leparan is also a subsistence farmer.  He is using the 20,000 KES loan to buy fuel, spare tires and spare parts.  He wants to own a fleet of vehicles that will operate along highways.  Leparan is married to a teacher and has three children ranging from one to five years. He describes himself as an aggressive, industrious enterpreneur.

loans.use: To buy spare tires, fuel and spare parts.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
La señora Lia con 56 años D. edad, trabaja en sus tierras hace 30 años, se caso con un buen hombre que la apoya en las faenas diarias.

Juntos los dos lograron comprar un lote y construir una pequeña casita, criando en ella a su pequeña hija Gilma, a la cual le hicieron estudiar y salir con una profesión, ahora ella los ayuda a cosechar la tierra, la señora Lia es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo D. mizque, y aunque aun lleva el dolor D. haber perdido a su única hermana hace poco, ella sigue trabajando y con la sonrisa en los labios desea hacer crecer su tierra y su pequeño ganado que con mucho esmero cuida.

Ella solo quiere ver culminada su obra, y así llama a la crianza D. su nieta y sus plantaciones, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra D. semilla D. papa y abono para sembrar, esto ayudara a incrementar sus cosecha y por enD. sus ingresos y alcanzar más rápido ese sueño D. doña lía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lia C. is 56 years old and has worked her land for some 30 years. She is married to a good man who helps her in the daily tasks.

Together, the two were able to buy a lot and build a small house in which to raise their little daughter Gilma. They directed her to study and qualify for a profession. Now, she helps them harvest the earth. Lia is very much loved and respected in her Mizque village. Though she still carries the burden of the recent loss of her only sister, Lia continues to work with a smile on her lips as she makes the land produce and raises her small herd of livestock with much care.

She only wishes to see her work culminated and, thus, also cares for her granddaughter's livestock and crops. This loan will be used to buy potato seeds and manure for the planting, thereby aiding the growth of the harvest and, in the end, her income, achieving more rapidly Lia's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POTATO SEEDS AND MANURE FOR SEWING CROPS

loans.name: Matida

texts.en: Matida is married to a teacher and they are blessed with four children. She is 32 years old. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. Her customers are mostly women and young ladies. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. This is the festive season and she is happy because her profits will increase. She needs a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Muno Mukabi Tayinula Rose Group

texts.en: T. Rose is the president of this group. She is twenty-seven years old and married with four children, three of whom are going to school. She operates a bakery business. She started her bakery four months ago and she will use the loan to purchase necessary items for the business. She prepares different types of cakes and other bakery goods. She is hoping to stock all the ingredients she will need for her baking. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land, construct a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary items for her bakery business.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 44-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working as a hairstylist since 2005 and has 14 years of experience in this field. Today, Rima is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy products and materials needed to augment her business productivity.

loans.use: to buy products and materials for her business

loans.name: Muno Mukabi Khaiza Justine Group

texts.en: K. Justine is representing her group. She is a hardworking business woman whose business is selling used clothes. She is thirty-two years old and married with six children, three of whom are going to school. She has been running her business for three years. The loan is helping her to add to her stock of used clothes for expanding her business. She is encouraged by her work, and her future hope is to construct a house

loans.use: To add to her stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of drinks in bulk

loans.name: Peter Kibuthu

texts.en:
Peter is married to Jeniffer and they have not yet had any children. Peter operates a second-hand clothing sales business outside of Nairobi. He was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is taking out his first loan. Peter plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothing (shirts, pants, etc). 

Peter's business is located in a very busy market and therefore he is able to reach many clients. With the extra profits he anticipates earning as a result of the loan, Peter plans to expand his business and reinvest in more stock of second-hand clothing. 

Peter hopes to build rental houses one day. He believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Hacia Al Futuro 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Anna, 25, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Hacia Al Futuro (Toward the Future), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

Anna lives with her husband in Boca Chica, a small town west of San Pedro. They have a nice home by Dominican standards, with cement floors and walls and a metal roof. Life in Boca Chica can be difficult, without access to potable water or reliable electricity. Despite any hardships, Anna runs a small business from her home, selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, her third with Esperanza International, she will be purchasing the latest styles to sell to her friends and neighbors for a small markup.

Anna is very thankful for her new access to credit. She had taken out loans before coming to Esperanza, but switched because the rates were better and a loan came with free health services. Anna said that her loans have helped her business very much, and that she and the members of her group have all learned to be better businesspeople. Thank you for lending to Anna and the Hacia al Futuro group!

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Akwal

texts.en:
Akwal M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Akwal is 55 years old and is married to a husband that is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: BilA. is a 48-year-old married man and father of 3 unemployed children. He works hard in his auto repair shop to provide better living conditions for his family. He has been working since 1995 and has 24 years of experience in this field. Today, BilA. is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a used car. He will perform maintenance on it in order to be able to sell it and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy a used car to repair and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hairdresser and she also sells hair materials like shampoo, hair-extensions and cream. She makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She hopes to own a fashion home in the future.

Regina is 53 years old and is married with 7 children. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria.

Regina hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more hair materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair materials to sell

loans.name: Muno Mukabi Bila Mazelele Group

texts.en:
Bila M. is the group representative of Muno Mukabi; she is a married woman, forty-five years old. She is blessed with five children of whom four are studying.

Bila has operated a pub business so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase pub items such as beers, cigarettes, wines, and so forth to meet her customers’ demands. She is adding stock to her business to generate more profit return. Her future hope is to invest in her rice growing scheme.

loans.use: To purchase pub items such as beers, cigarettes, wines, and so forth

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Fatma H. is a widow with four children aged 12, 14, 18 and 7 years. Fatma has operated a flour business (lishe - a variety of maize) for two years now and works from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She manages to make a monthly profit of  around $317.

This is Fatma’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She says she hopes for a loan to increase her capital and pack more flour bags for sale.

Fatma will share this loan with her loan group, Tamalinda, which has eighteen members. Many of the group have small restaurants like Christina, but some of them have salons, tailoring shops, fish stands, and produce shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Faruma is first from the right in the first row.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her flour business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has been the owner of a wheel repair shop since 1999. He is 39 years old and married with two young children. He has been able to meet his children's needs over the years – thanks to his business income. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a Rapid car to facilitate his business movements.

loans.use: To buy a Rapid car

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. has been running a car wash business for the last seven years in Naivasha town. He is a 36-year-old man who is married to Razoa Anupi. Together they have three children of school-going age. With this loan, Joseph intends to buy his own mopping machine for his car wash business (a machine that washes cars with sponges). With the new machine he will be in a position to serve his loyal customers in an efficient and timely manner. He expects this to help uplift his living standards. He dreams of expanding his car wash business by venturing into other places and towns.

This is Joseph’s first loan from KADET and he is grateful for the opportunity to borrow as he has been unable to access financial help from any other microfinance institution. He received information about KADET from an existing borrower group and then gathered his friends to form a new one.

loans.use: To buy a mopping machine for his car wash business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for her bar business

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to his customers. He is a hardworking man and he is determined to lift his family out of poverty. He is 55 years old and married with six children. His wife sells foodstuffs to help support the family. He hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. 
Sunday says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a married woman and the mother of four children who still go to school. She is 38 years old. She has been in clothing sales since 1999 to help her husband raise the children. Today, Salma is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy additionA. clothes so she can increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working as a tailor since 1999 to earn additional income for her family. Today, Rima is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy tools and textiles to make a variety of products. She wants to become well known to attract clients.

loans.use: To buy tools and textiles

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
La señora Marisabel es una joven de 25 años ella se caso muy joven tienen 3 hermosos hijos de (7,4 años y 2 meses) actualmente su esposo se encuentra en otra ciudad por cuestiones de trabajo. Marisabel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a la una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, apenas empieza ya que actualmente cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado lechero.

Marisabel vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Machajmarca, aun no tiene casa propia ya que vive en la casa de su madre.El crédito será destinado para la construcción de un establo lo cual es importante para la protección de su ganado ya que se aproxima la temporada de lluvia.
 
Entre los sueños y metas de Marisabel, es tener una granja de ganado lechero  de por lo menos 30 cabezas de ganado, tener su propia casa y que sus 3 pequeños hijos estudien y que tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisabel is a 25 year old woman. She married very young and has 3 beautiful children (7 years, 4 years and 2 months of age). At the moment, her husband is in another city for work. Marisabel is dedicated to the production of raw milk which she delivers to a company which produces dairy products. She just started this business as she currently has only 4 heads of dairy cattle. Marisabel lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Machajmarca community where she does not have own home as she lives in her mother's house. The loan will go to building a stable, which is important for the protection of her livestock because the rainy season is approaching. Among Marisabel's dreams and goals is to have a dairy farm of at least 30 heads of cattle, have her own home and that her 3 small children study and have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable to house her daily cattle

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 35 years old and happily married with four children. She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. She hopes to own a drink factory in the future. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John J. is 31 years old and married. He is a businessman who sells different home products. He also sells cereals in Mombasa's Port-Reitz area. John has been selling his products for two years now.

He joined KADET recently and is taking his first loan from KADET to boost his business. With his loan, John plans to increase his stock of household wares and purchase cereals to sell. His main clients are the households around the area.

He hopes to establish a better store to do his business in the future. He wants to improve his standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy household wares and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sofi

texts.en:
Sofi R. currently sells food in a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase beer and soft drinks such as sodas, water, packed juice, etc to sell.  Sofi is 42 years old and is married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children up to the university.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La señora María Luz tiene 37 años está casado, tienen dos hermosos hijos de 19 y 14 años, actualmente el hijo mayor estudia una carrera técnica y el hijo mayor está en la secundaria, los dos hijos ayudan mucho a su mamá ya que su esposo trabaja de albañil en la misma comunidad.

Doña María Luz vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de  MachajMarca, tienen una pequeña casa donde tienen sus 4 cabezas de ganado lechero para la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos, ella tiene la meta de tener una granja de ganado lechero grande para mejorar sus ingresos.

El crédito será destinado para la construcción de un establo, esto le ayudara para la protección de su ganado sobre todo ahora que empieza la temporada de lluvia. La señora María Luz tiene una meta muy grande es tener una granja muy grande y ver profesional a sus tres hijos para que en futuro puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María Luz is 37, married, and has two beautiful children who are 19 and 14. Her oldest son is currently studying for a technical career, and her youngest son is in high school. Both of the children help their mother a lot. Her husband works as a bricklayer in the same community. María Luz lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Machajmarca community. They have a small house where they have four head of dairy cows for the production of raw milk. They distribute their product to a business that makes different types of dairy products. Her goal is to have a large dairy farm in order to improve their income. The loan is to build a stable. This will help to protect the livestock, especially now that the rainy season is starting. María Luz has a very big goal. It is to have a very large farm and to see her children become professionals so that they can have a better level of life in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a stable to house the livestock

loans.name: Evah

texts.en:
Evah K. is married to Kennedy Macharia and they are blessed with one daughter, Lilian. Evah is in the business of selling clothes in Mombasa's Mwembe Tayari market. She has been selling clothes for the last three years and she believes her business is doing well.

Evah joined KADET a while ago and she is now accessing her second loan. She managed to service her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 well. With this new loan, Evah intends to boost her business by purchasing more clothing to sell to customers. 

Evah hopes to expand her business further and become a major supplier of all kinds of clothing.

[This photo was taken in the Mombasa KADET office when Evah came to meet with a loan officer.]

loans.use: To buy more clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. is a 32-year-old man married to Mary O.. Together they have two children ages six and three. 

Joseph operates a vehicle repair business. He has been repairing and spraying vehicles in a garage situated in Naivasha town. This is Joseph’s first loan from KADET and he has never borrowed from any micro finance institution before. He learned about KADET through his friends who are already clients.

With his loan, Joseph intends to buy a battery charging system. By introducing this new service, he will be in a position to serve his potential clientele better and more efficiently. He expects to receive more clients and therefore be able to improve his family’s living standards. 

He aspires to start a vehicle spare parts business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a battery charging system for his vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
La  Señora María de Lourdes  de 33 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Tres Marías perteneciente  al Municipio de Chalco, En el Estado de México;  ella es casada  y tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos están en edad escolar, por lo que inicio una actividad de artículos  papelería y elaboración de manualidades (figuras de fomi, fieltro y demás) hace mas de 3 años,  ella inicia con esta actividad  debido a que su esposo trabaja en la central de abasto (alimentos) como cargador  y los ingresos que obtiene no le es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de la familia; por lo que ella para no descuidar la educación y cuidado de sus hijos, la cual es prioridad y anhela ver que sus hijos tengan estudios, ella requiere de mas capital e invertir en su negocio, generando mayor ganancia y así poder comprar una computadora que le ayudara a imprimir sus propios diseños para sus manualidades; por esta razón se une con otros conocidos para solicitar un crédito a través de Fundación Realidad A.C. que tambien tienen búscan una mejor calidad de vida.
Ma Trinidad J.  B.      Elaboración de casos.
Virginia M. Gutiérrez         Venta de Catalogó. 
Fabiola B. J.           Venta de Catalogó.
Ma Guadalupe Z. S.      Venta de Catalogó.
María José M. P.         Abarrotes.
Edith R. R.              Jarcería.
Irma G. T.               Botanas.
Gloria H. C.  	 Dulces.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Lourdes is 33 years old and lives in the Tres Marías community in the municipality of Chalco, in Mexico state. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are school-aged. This is why she began working with paper products and making crafts (shapes made of foam, felt, and other materials). She began more than three years ago, since her husband works in a food warehouse as a loader and his income is not enough to cover the family's needs. She chose this line of work to avoid neglecting the education and care of her children--which is her main priority, and she desires to see her children studying. She needs more capital to invest in her business, in order to generate higher earnings and be able to buy a computer to help her print her own designs for her crafts. For this reason she is getting together with other people she knows to ask for a loan through Fundación Realidad A.C. as they are looking for a better quality of life.

María Trinidad J. B.-Crafts Virginia M. Gutiérrez-Catalog Sales Fabiola B. J.-Catalog Sales María Guadalupe Z. S.-Catalog Sales María José M. P.-Groceries Edith R. R.-Housewares Irma G. T.-Snacks Gloria H. C.-Sweets

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for designing crafts

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio T. is married, and all his children are fully grown.

Constancio’s business is providing the ingredients for chip stands. He has a strategic location in town and thanks to high quality and quick service, he has built up a loyal clientele and makes a good profit. He will use his loan to purchase cheese, starch, oils and other ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, starch, oils and other ingredients

loans.name: Carlos Albino

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 42 años está casado, tienen 3 hijos, don Carlos cuando era un niño ya ayudaba a su madre desde entonces se dedica a la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos, en la familia de don Carlos todos trabajan es decir que los tres hijos ayudan en el trabajo de cada día.

Don Carlos y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de MachajMarca, en su casa es donde tienen sus 8 cabezas de ganado lechero.El crédito será destinado para la terminar la construcción de su establo esto es muy importante para la protección de su ganado, ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvia.

El sueño más importante de don Carlos es ver con una carrera profesional a sus tres hijos, y aumentar la producción de la leche cruda.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ever since he was a boy he used to help his mother, and since then has worked in fresh milk production. The product is then delivered to a business that works making different dairy products. Everyone in Carlos' family works, meaning that his three children help with the job every day.

Mr. Carlos and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the MachajMarca community. They have their 8 milk-cows at home with them. The loan is to be used to finish constructing his stable. This is very important for protecting the livestock, since the rainy season is approaching.

Mr. Carlos' greatest dream is to see each of his three children with a professional career, and to increase production of the fresh milk.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish constructing a stable to house livestock

loans.name: Chukwadi

texts.en: Twenty-eight years old and single without children, Chukwadi has a stall where he makes and sells cellophane at retail prices to his customers.  A member of the Igbo tribe, he lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where he works and sells for long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs and necessities of his aged parents. Chukwadi hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials to make more cellophane to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more cellophane to sell

loans.name: Kawama Kakaire Jamilah Group

texts.en: K. Jamilah is the president of her group.  She is married with six children, four of whom are going to school.  She also takes care of an orphan who is in sixth grade.  K. Jamilah sells new clothes and has been in business for one year. She is seeking a loan to add capital to her business by purchasing inventory. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to raise and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Rakela

texts.en: Rakela S. is currently in the business of selling beans in the market and is requesting a loan to buy other items such as millet, maize flour, etc, to sell. Rakela is 35 years old and is married to a taxi driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and to build a house for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy other items such as millet, maize flour, etc., to sell

loans.name: Las Dalias 3 Group

texts.en:
Camila, 31, a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic, is the coordinator for her group, Las Dalias (“Dahlias” - a type of flower), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Camila will be using this loan, her very first with Esperanza International, to purchase supplies for her beauty salon. She hopes to buy more hair products and equipment to help her work on her customers’ nails. Camila came to Esperanza because she could not find credit elsewhere and to receive the health services that will be provided to her whole family.

Camila is a single mother, and Los Alcarrizos, a very poor area outside of the capital, Santo Domingo, is not an easy place to raise a family. Running water, if available, is never potable, electricity is scarce, and sanitation is at a minimum. Camila’s beauty salon is run from her home, and with growing children it can be quite crowded. Despite these hardships, Camila is grateful for any business support she can get. She hopes her extra profits will help her to support her children by sending them to good schools. Thank you for lending to Camila and Las Dalias group!

loans.use: Hair and nail supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and is married with seven children. Her husband sells building materials to also support the home.

Cecilia sells Nigerian cooked foods like eba (cassava dough eaten with soup), egusi (a soup made with ground melon seeds, vegetables, seasonings and meat), moi-moi (steamed bean cake), boiled yam, and fufu (starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew).

The demands for Cecilia’s cooked foods are high. She wakes up daily at 4:00 a.m. to start the preparation of her cooked foods. She is a hard worker and she hopes to excel in her business.

Cecilia hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For 10 years Rose N. has had a boutique selling both cosmetics and clothes to workers from Mumias Sugar and other locales. In this business, she contends with competition and having to travel long distances to purchase goods.

Rose is married to a driver, and they have one child, three years old. She will use the proceeds of this loan to buy more inventory for her boutique, and ultimately she would like to build her business and have a big boutique as well as a restaurant. In addition to her boutique, Rose also sells fish and describes herself as God-fearing, honest, but hot-tempered!

loans.use: Ladies cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman, trabaja como procurador realizando tramites legales de todo tipo.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para educación (pago de tutor, elaboración de tesis, tramites en el ministerio de educación y universidad, para obtener su titulo de abogado)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Roman works as a lawyer doing legal procedures of all kinds. He lives in the Miraflores region of the city of La Paz, in a rented house. The loan will be used for education (payment for a tutor, production of a thesis, procedures in the ministry of education and university, and to obtain his law degree). This is the first time he is requesting a loan with Impro. The desire to improve himself gives him the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a tutor, production of a thesis, ministry and university procedures for his law degree.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells bags of melon at both wholesale and retail prices to her customers. In Nigeria, melon is used in the preparation of egusi soup (a soup made with ground melon seeds, vegetables, seasonings and meat). The demand for her bags of melon is high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Mary is 31 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells foodstuffs to also support the home.

Mary hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of melon to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of melon to sell

loans.name: Erico

texts.en:
Erico is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He has been working as a vendor since 2005, when he started selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, Capri pants and skirts. Erico started with a clientele of only twenty and currently has over three hundred customers.

Erico’s business has a very high turnover rate, so constantly requires further investment in order to grow. He will use this loan to buy shorts and Capri pants, which are currently in very high demand by his customers, as summer is just starting.

After satisfying his customers’ demands, Erico hopes to use the remainder of his stock to open another store in a different part of town.

loans.use: To buy shorts and Capri pants

loans.name: Dengala Sibali Topista Group

texts.en: S. Topista is a hardworking business woman and a representative of her group. She is forty years old and married with ten children; four of her children are going to school, and she is taking care of two dependents. She runs a retail shop that she has been operating for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase essential items, such as sugar, soap, and salt, so she can increase her sales and profits. Her future hope is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase essential items such as sugar, soap, and salt

loans.name: Soba Soba Butamisi Safi Group

texts.en:
B. Safi is thirty-eight years old and is married with six children of whom five are going to school. She also looks after three orphans of whom two are schooling.

Safi owns a bakery that she has been operating for over six years. Due to insufficient capital, she is using the loan to purchase bread ingredients such as cooking oil, baking powder, wheat flour, etc., to improve her business.

Safi is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to prosper and to raise her children to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase bread ingredients such as cooking oil, baking powder, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, es costurera y tiene un taller de costura, donde realiza trabajos de costura de trajes para damas y también arreglos en general.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa como cuidadora.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra tela, forro e hilos)
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Elvira is a seamstress and she has a shop where she makes women’s suits and does different types of alterations. She lives in the Miraflores area of La Paz, in a house where she is a caretaker. The loan will be used as capital for her work (to buy fabric, lining, and thread). This is the fifth time she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her as a client.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, linings, and thread for her seamstress shop

loans.name: Ijoma

texts.en:
Ijoma sells bags of rice and beans at wholesale prices. She loves this business because her customers pay cash when they purchase her goods. She hopes to expand her business in future.

Ijoma is 48 years old and is married with four children who are all excelling in their school and trade.

Ijoma hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of beans and rice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Segundo Benancio

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad en el sector Poste Blanco del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica al transporte de carga y de pasajeros en su mototaxi. Este negocio es el único ingreso económico con el que viene sustentando a su familia, por lo que todos los días se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacarlos adelante. Segundo trabaja desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las cinco y treinta de la tarde.

Debido al mal estado de los caminos y de la mayoría de calles que recorre diariamente, hace algunos días su unidad móvil sufrió algunas fallas mecánicas que la han dejado inoperativa, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para cubrir los gastos de reparación.

Segundo nos comenta que su más grande anhelo es instalar una pequeña tienda que le permita tener los ingresos suficientes para terminar de construir su casa. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución en oportunidades anteriores y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsablidad al momento de asumir sus pagos, por lo que es considerado un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 33 year old father. He lives with his wife and his two children, 11 and 8, in the Poste Blanco sector of the Paiján distict, Ascope province, La Libertad region. This is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked for three years transporting cargo and passengers in his "mototaxi" (three wheeled motorized taxi). This business is the only source of economic income that he has to support his family. Therefore, everyday he puts forth his maximum effort to be able to get them ahead. Segundo works from six thirty in the morning until five thirty in the afternoon. Due to the bad condition of the paths and the majority of the streets that he travels daily, his taxi suffered mechanical difficulties and stopped working several days ago. That is why he saw the necessity of asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 500 PEN to cover the repair costs. Segundo tells us that his big wish is to set up a small store that would allow him to have sufficient income to finish building his house. He has worked with our institution previously, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments. Therefore, he is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair expenses for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene una imprenta donde realiza trabajos de impresión de folletos, libros, menbretados, y otros.
Su domicilio y su taller de imprenta se encuentran ubicados  la calle comercio de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada, tiene dos empleados y requiere el crédito para la compra de papel cola y tintas
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson has a printing press where he produces brochures, books, engraved stationary, and other items. His home and his printing workshop are located in a rented house in a commercial street in the central part of the city of La Paz. He has 2 employees and he needs a loan to buy paper, glue and inks. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO. The desire to work and improve his quality of life has motivated him to pursue this credit opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paper, glue and inks for his printing business

loans.name: Soba Soba Nambozo Sulaina Group

texts.en:
N. Sulaina is forty-five years old and is married with eight children, all schooling. More so, she looks after four orphans who are all schooling, too.

Sulaina operates a shop which she has been running for eight years. She is using the loan to add stock to her shop. She will purchase retail items such as drinks, soap, sodas, sugar, and so forth.

Sulaina is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to lift her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has owned a car accessories shop in his town since 2005. He is a 28-year-old single man. He has been involved in this business since 1995.  Ahmad is requesting $1,000 to buy merchandise and accessories needed to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and accessories

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 36, is married, and has two children. He has been in the courier and delivery business for over four years.

Francisco has two trucks with freight service, with which he delivers honey from a factory in the town of Piribebuy. He bought his first truck with money his wife earned while working in the U.S. where she has relatives. The second he bought with savings from his work.

Francisco will use this loan to purchase a cargo cover for one of his trucks so that he can deliver more and travel more safely with his freight covered. Francisco is a good client of Fundación Paraguaya, which is why his credit line is being extended on this, his next loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cargo cover for his truck

loans.name: Lameck

texts.en:
Lameck M. N., 27, has run the "Classic Store" with his wife for the last six months. The store is located in a residential area in Magongo and they sell cereals, paraffin (kerosene), vegetable oil, sugar, detergents, rice, flour, etc. His challenges are that customers can't pay at the end of their pay cycles and further, over the holidays, many return to their villages and his business suffers.

Lameck is using his KES 80,000 loan to open another branch of the store in a busy new area.

Lameck also runs a barber shop where he has an employee. His long term business goal is to be a wholesaler and supply goods to small retail shops in Mombassa.

Lameck and his wife (pictured) have no children yet, but Lameck's goal is to have a stable life for his family with a house, a car, and good education for his own children. He is hardworking and feels confident that he can reach whatever goals he sets for himself.

loans.use: To open another branch of his store

loans.name: Boris

texts.es:
Boris, trabaja como radiólogo en la clínica petrolera y  requiere el crédito para la compra de una computadora, que podrá ayudarle en el desempeño de su trabajo y algunos seminarios que realiza
Vive en la zona de tembladerani  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajar y superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Boris works as a radiologist at the oil company clinic and requests the loan to buy a computer to help him carry out his work and some seminars.

He lives in the zone of Tembladerani of the City of La Paz at his parents' house.

It is the first time he requests a loan with Impro, his desire to really want to work and improve has given him the opportunity to gain access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to prepare his work as an radiologist and seminars.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Charity is 28 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home.

This is the high season for Charity’s business and she hopes to make more profits. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia ISABEL es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos varones. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de pollos y después los vende. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos para luego venderlos en las ferias del Cusco.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The partner ISABEL is a humble mother who belongs to the community bank "VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA".

The partner is 42 years old, married, with four sons. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura located south of the town of Cusco. The partner takes care of her home as well as breeds chickens which she sells. She has been working her business for several years and has done well thanks to her enthusiasm. Our partner is a working and entrepreneurial mother who will make her family get ahead. The partner requires a loan to buy chickens to sell at the markets of Cusco.

The partner is grateful for this opportunity and she promises to repay punctually

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner requires the loan to buy chickens to be sold at markets in Cusco.

loans.name: Ko´eju Group

texts.en: The Ko’eju Committee is a group of women entrepreneurs who invest capital from the Fundacion Paraguaya in their businesses. They have taken advantage of the skills and training workshops offered by the Fundacion, and support each other in their endeavors and other financial matters. They would like to thank those who have given them a chance to grow and improve their livelihood through microloans. Step by step they are bettering the quality of their lives and building brighter futures for themselves and their children. They have applied for a new loan to buy additional merchandise to sell to their customers.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Dominga Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Dominga M. desde joven a trabajado como docente, pues estudio en  un centro para maestra el cual ha sido su medio de sobresalir adelante con su familia, lleva veinte tres años enseñando a los jóvenes el cual se siente sastifecha por poder ejercer su trabajo como ayudar a muchos a despertar el interés a  prender, su meta es poder seguir construyendo un cuarto para alquilar ya que tiene una bodega de zinc y ahí va a derivar y comenzara a construir un cuarto de concreto para alquilarlo y poder seguir teniendo un ingreso mas para  sus gastos ya que su salario es bajo,  para esto  comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hiero, piso. Lo cual espera terminar. Esto solo lo esta logrando con ayuda de la financiera Afodenic que por su bajo interés y plazo lograra poder tener un cuarto mas,  para ofrecer al alquiler, con los otros financiamiento ha hecho lo mismo en mejorar cuartos ya serian tres con esto lo que alquilaría.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga M. has been working as a teacher since she was young as she studied at a center for teachers and this has been her means to get ahead with her family. She has been teaching young people for twenty-three years, and she feels satisfied being able to carry out her job as she awakens interest in learning in many people. Her goal is to continue building a room for rent as she owns a zinc construction and wants to build a concrete room for rent to obtain an extra income to cover expenses as her salary is low. For this she needs to buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and floor covering in order to finish. She is succeeding with the support of Financiera Afodenic because of the low interest rate and terms. With this room it will be the third room she has been able to remodel and build for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, iron to build a room for rent.

loans.name: Soba Soba Sawuya Bongo Group

texts.en: Sawuya B. is a 47-year-old widow with eight children, all of whom are in school, who also cares for three other dependents. For the last year, she has made a living selling charcoal. Sawuya also leads a lending group with six other members, and will use her portion of this loan to buy additional charcoal to sell to her customers. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to expand her business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: To make a living, Patience sells CDs and VCDs (video compact discs) at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She is a highly-focused, hard-working woman. She is also friendly and uses her skills to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes to be a major distributor of VCDs in her community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and also works hard to support his family. She has applied for a loan for 150,000 NGN to buy more CDs and VCDs to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for helping make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and VCDs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Héctor T.  vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Héctor es chofer asalariado en el trasporte público, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de cocina en su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Héctor T. lives with his parents in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He is a salaried public transport driver, with a stable income. He is requesting a loan to build a kitchen in his home. This is the 4th time that he has requested a loan, and he has already been approved for the loan based on a socioeconomic analysis.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a kitchen in his home

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia NELLY es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hijo de ocho años. Su hijo estudia en el colegio y esta en el segundo grado de primaria. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella es de profesión enfermera y trabaja por las mañanas en el  Seguro Social de Salud (ESSALUD). La socia por las tardes alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de pollos y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos para luego venderlos en las ferias del Cusco y así aumentar el capital de negocio.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nelly is a humble mother who belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She is 29 years old and is a single mother of her 8-year-old son. Her son attends school and is in the second grade of elementary school. She lives in the San Jerónimo district within the Angostura region, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She is a nurse and works during the mornings for Seguro Social de Salud (ESSALUD). She alternates during the afternoons her activities in the house with raising chickens and the sale of wood. She has been performing this job for a few years and it has been going well, thanks to all the determination that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and determined mother who is getting ahead with her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more chickens to place them for sell in the Cusco market. This way, she will increase the capital for her business. She is thankful of the opportunity granted to her through this method and she promises to complete all the scheduled repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell in the Cusco markets

loans.name: Emélé

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une revendeuse dynamique d’articles de mercerie, elle exerce son commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a nommé «  Ets ALADJA ». Elle fait ce commerce depuis 1990, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de  produits génériques. La période des fêtes de fin d’année est très bénéfiques pour le commerce de mercerie, elle voudrait vendre plus c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock avec l’achat de 3 boîtes de boutons, 5 tas de fermetures, une trentaine de fils à coudre,  divers articles de mercerie et  divers produits génériques.
Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emélé A. is a dynamic dry goods saleswoman. She does her business in her own shop which she named "Ets Aladja." She has been in business since 1990 and only later incorporated the sale of generic products. The end-of-year holiday season is very busy for the her trade. She is asking for a loan from WAGES because she would like to increase her stock and sell more during this time. With this loan, she will purchase 3 boxes of buttons, 5 loads of clasps, 30 spools of thread, and various dry goods and generic products. She is married and the mother of 3 children. With the profits, she would support her family financially .

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of Seamstress Supplies and Various Products

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos.
La señora Viviana trabaja como empleada en una ladrillería de su zona, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de el muro perimetral de su vivienda y darle así mayor seguridad a sus pertenencias. 
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Viviana C. lives in her own home with her three children in the Llojeta region on the west side of La Paz. Viviana works in a brick-making company in her area and supports her family with the income she earns. The loan she is requesting is for the construction of a wall on the edge of her home which will secure her belongings. The socioeconomic analysis for her business is favorable and she qualifies for this loan, the second that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a wall in her home

loans.name: Comite Las Amigas Group

texts.en: The Women Entrepreneurs Committee “Las Amigas” is made up of 18 women, all from the same neighborhood. They are currently in their 13th loan cycle as part of the Fundacion Paraguaya Women’s Entrepreneuship Program. With each loan cycle, they all participate in training workshops where they learn how to save, budget and market their businesses. They use their loans to expand their businesses, which involve selling clothing and furniture, and running manicure salons and food stands where they sell “chipas," a traditional Paraguayan cheese bread.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Junior Alexis

texts.es:
Junior tiene 20 años de edad , es soltero y vive junto a su madre, su abuelo y sus tres hermanos en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Rázuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región la Libertad, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que tenía trece años se dedica a la panadería. Su abuelo instaló en su casa un pequeño establecimiento donde comercializan los productos que ellos mismos elaboran en un horno instalado en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Usualmente comercializan panes, bizcochos y algunos dulces. Este negocio familiar se ha constituído como el único ingreso que cubre sus gastos familiares.

Junior se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panetones. El aprendió cómo hacerlos hace algunos años y desde entonces los ha venido preparando y comercializando durante todas las temporadas navideñas.

Junior gusta mucho de lo que hace, su más grande anhelo es seguir sacando adelante la panadería y trabajar hasta convertirse en distribuidores. El es un joven inteligente, laborioso y muy creativo. En la fotografía aparece mostrándonos los primeros panetones que ya está elaborando.
texts.en:
Junior is 20 years old and single. He lives with his mother, grandfather, and three siblings in Puerto Malabrigo, District of Rázuri, Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad. This community is located 3½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Junior has been working in a bakery since he was 13 years old. His grandfather established this business in their home, where they sell products that they bake themselves in an oven located at the back of the house. They usually sell breads, cakes, and some sweets. This family business provides the only source of income to cover their expenses.

Junior is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles in order to buy ingredients for making panettone. He learned how to make this delicacy a few years ago and since then, he has been preparing and selling panettone every Christmas season.

Junior really enjoys what he does. His greatest dream is to continue making the bakery successful so that they eventually become distributors. He is an intelligent, hardworking, and very creative young man. In the photograph, Junior shows off the first batch of panettone that he has prepared.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making panettone

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: La Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Maura lives in Samana, the Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her loan group, La Fe (Faith), and her story is typical of the people in her group.

Maura runs a small business selling clothing to friends and neighbors. She is a single mother with one child, a boy, and runs her business out of her home, which she rents. Maura plans to use this loan, her third with Esperanza International, to buy new shoes and perfume to sell to her customers. She also hopes to hire an employee to help her expand her customer base and increase sales. Life in Samana can be difficult, with little access to potable water, reliable electricity and medical care. With her loan, she hopes to improve her living conditions, and will also receive health care from Esperanza International.

With her increasing profits, Maura hopes to one day move her business out of her home and into its own location. She does not like having to work in her home, and would like to create more space for her family. Maura also hopes to stop renting and have her own home one day, a place where her son can study and get a good education. She would like him to become a person who can overcome hardships and be a professional in whatever field he chooses. Thank you for lending to Maura and La Fe group!

loans.use: To buy more shoes and perfume to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Jenny F., es madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos dos ya que trabajan y uno estudia la secundaria, su trabajo es maestra de secundaria que ha ejercido durante veinte seis años, junto con su esposo ya que también el trabaja como docente. Estudio en el colegio Normal para sacar su diploma y poder cumplir con su requisito. Gracias a Dios y a su trabajo han logrado poder hacer su casa toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Poco a podo han comprado los muebles, ropero, pero a un su casa es de suelo, lo cual ella desea poder poner piso ya que sus muebles se están fregando, en la mera tierra es por eso ve la necesidad de comprar piso para una mejor higiene como para poder gozar de una mejoras mas, para después comenzar a repellar y a pintar su casa todo esto solo  lo puede hacer a largo plazo ya que toda esta caro pero si con una esperanza a futuro de poder arreglar su casa bonita
Con el crédito anterior logro poner toda la electricidad a su casa con su medidor para una mejor distribución de energía como mejor seguridad. Muy contenta de poder lograr sus planes como madre de familia a través del los prestamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny F. is the mother of three beautiful children. Two of them work while the other one is a high school student. Jenny has been teaching at the high school level for twenty years. She works with her husband, who is also a teacher. Jenny studied at a teacher’s college to earn her degree and was able to complete all of her requirements.

Thanks to God, her work has allowed her to build a concrete house to provide her family with better security. Over time she has purchased furniture and installed a closet, but her house has a dirt floor. She wants to install flooring because right now she has to constantly clean her furniture. A proper floor will also provide better hygiene and help her family enjoy additional improvements. Afterwards she will be able to begin plastering and painting her house, which can be completed over the long term. All of these improvements are expensive, but she hopes they will make her house more beautiful.

With her previous loan, Jenny was able to equip her house for electricity by installing a meter for better distribution of energy. This provided her family with more secure conditions. She is very happy that she can use these loans to fulfill her plans as a mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a floor

loans.name: Omoh

texts.en: Omoh O. is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a printer and he also supports the family. Omoh sells local gin popularly known as ogogoro in Nigeria. She is happy because the dry season is here and she hopes to make more sales during this season. Her customers are both men and women. It gives her joy when she sees customers coming to her stall to drink. She hopes to expand her business in the future by including the sale of foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Tukwatire Wamu Twaha Zaina Group

texts.en:
Zaina T. is thirty years old, married with five children, four of whom are schooling. She is a creative business woman who designs table mats and floor mats. She  has been doing this for over four years. She will use the loan to add materials for table mats, floor mats, etc for sale. Zaina is a hardworking business lady who is working very hard to obtain enough savings so that she can stand on her own.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To add materials for table mats, floor mats, etc for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Q. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
La señora Maria elabora artesanías y tejidos que vende a una empresa de su zona y su esposo es empleado en una carpintería ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina e instalación de gas domiciliario para su vivienda.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Q. lives in her parents' home in the Las Lomas area west of the city of La Paz with her husband and their two children. Maria makes crafts and knitted goods that she sells at a store in her neighborhood. Her husband works as a carpenter, and their income supports the family. The requested loan is for the construction of a kitchen and the installation of gas for their home. This is the sixth loan they have requested. A socioeconomic analysis has rated them favorably and has allowed them to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen and installation of gas to the house

loans.name: Basilia Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Basilia mujer activa se desempeña en la costura, a la venta de cosméticos, y zapatos, durante muchos años laboro en zona franca pero con deseo de superar renuncio por que el salario es bajo, y no prestan todo el servicio de ley, con su liquidación logro comprar su propia maquina de coser, el cual ahora  cose en su propia casa y ha ido teniendo los clientes del barrio, vende cosméticos de la Avon el cual trabaja por encargo de los producto pero mucho de sus clientes compran perfume y es lo que mas compra  para vender. Trabaja medio tiempo en una maquila el cual su salario es por producción, ahí labora lindo vestido, de dama como de traje de caballero. Contenta por que hasta ahora le ha ido mejor, ya que puede realizar su trabajo y puede vender al mismo tiempo. Sus planes es poder confensionar sus propios trajes para vender es por eso con este préstamo comprara tela variada en diversos colores, como producto de Avon pintura, perfumenes, cremas entre otro y poder cada día crecer en su negocio, todo esto con ayuda de su esposo y gracias al financiamiento de la institución.
texts.en:
Basilia is a very active woman who works as a seamstress and sells cosmetics and shoes. For many years she worked in a free zone and wanted to quit because the pay was low and and they did not offer full legal services. With her settlement, she was able to buy her own sewing machine. Now she sews in her own home and has customers from her neighborhood. She sells Avon cosmetics, and many of her customers buy perfume, so that is what she buys to sell most often. She works part time in a workshop producing pretty dresses as well as men's suits. She is glad that so far she is doing better, as she can do her job and be able to make sales at the same time. Her plan is to be able to produce her own suits to sell. She is requesting this loan in order to buy materials of various colors as well as Avon makeup, perfumes, and creams among other things so she can expand her business a little bit every day. She will do all this with the help of her husband and thanks to the institution's financing.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials of various colors and Avon makeup, perfume, and creams

loans.name: El Señor De Chalma Group

texts.es:
El grupo El señor de Chalma esta integrado por 11 clientes de la comunidad de Sn. Miguel Tlacamama se encuentra ubicado a escasos 10 kms. de Pinotepa Nacional, todos son comerciantes, muchas personas en la region se dedican a la venta de quesos frescos como es el caso de Isidora Alberta C. que vende queso fresco desde hace cinco años, sus hermanos le proporcionaban el producto ya que ellos son los que cuentan con ganado vacuno y ellos mismos lo elaboran, a ella le daban un porcentaje de la ganancia obtenida cada vez que salia a vender, ahora con el dinero del credito comenta que va a comprar el producto a sus hermanos y que de ese modo iniciará su pequeño negocio ya que el producto se vende muy bien en la región y se considera que es un producto de primera necesidad y el precio no es muy alto, con sus utilidades que obtenga seguirá inviertiendo en su negocio de venta de quesos y continuará con la compra  de puercos para engordarlos y venderlos en pie que es una de las actividades que ha realizado tambien ya desde hace 8 años aproximadamente.
considera que es parte de su responsabilidad la recuperación del credito ya que de ello depende que continue recibiendo el beneficio que la Fundación le ofrece y que de ese modo podra ayudar con los gastos a su esposo que es campesino y asus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años.
El resto de los integrantes del grupo son comerciantes tambien, el dinero del credito lo utilizán para comprar y vender verduras,abarrotes, quesos frescos,ropa para dama, comprar igredientes para preparar tacos blandos, refrescos,tamales de carne de puerco y pagar el transporte al lugar de donde adquieren la mercancia y los ingredientes ya sea en la cd. de Acapulgo Guerrero ó Pinotepa Nacional, como es el caso de la sra Maria Apolinaria R. compra chiles verdes y pescado seco en el mercado de pinotepa y revende en pueblos circunvecinos de tlacamama ella nos comenta que es quien mantiene a su  esposo ya que padece de una enfermedad en los pies que no le permite trabajar y como no recibe el apoyo de ninguno de sus hijos ella es quien desde hace cinco años es la que lleva el sustento de su familia y que espera que Dios le ayude dijo para continuar pagando bien y seguir recibiendo el credito que le ofrece la Fundación como lo ha hecho desde hace ya dos años y medio.
Todas las personas del grupo tienen como principal objetivo contribuir economicamente a sus familias con las ganancias que obtienen del trabajo que ellas realizán día con día y mejorar así su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The "El Señor de Chalma" group is made up of 11 clients in the Sn. Miguel Tlacamama community, located about 10 kilometers from Pinotepa Nacional. They are all merchants. Many people in the region sell fresh cheeses, which is the case for Isidora Alberta C., who has sold them for five years. Her siblings split up the profits, since they are the ones who own the cows and make the product themselves. They give her a percentage of the profits when she goes to sell. Now, with the loan money, she will buy the product from her siblings and start her own small business. The product sells very well in the region and is considered an inexpensive basic necessity. With the supplies she obtains, she will keep investing in her cheese-selling business and continue purchasing pigs to fatten and sell them. She has done this activity for about eight years. She considers it part of her responsibility to recuperate the loan because the group depends on continuing to receive the benefits of the foundation. She will be able to help her husband, a peasant farmer, with the expenses, and also help her children, who are eight and ten years old. The rest of the group members are also merchants. They will use the loan money to buy and sell vegetables, groceries, fresh cheeses, and women's clothing; buy ingredients for tacos, beverages, and pork tamales; and pay to transport merchandise and ingredients to the cities of Acapulgo Guerrero and Pinotepa Nacional. Maria Apolinaria R. buys green chiles and dried fish in the Pinotepa market and resells them in villages near Tlacamama. She says that she takes care of her husband, who has a leg disease that does not allow him to work. Since they do not receive support from any of their children, it is she who has supported her family for five years. She hopes that God will help her continue to make her payments and keep receiving credit from the foundation, as she has been doing for the past two and a half years. All of the group members' principal objective is to contribute economically to their families with their day-to-day earnings, and thus improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and make products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia H. vive en alquiler, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Julia es costurera, elaborando deportivos para una empresa que le da el material de trabajo y su esposo es empleado en una tornería de la ciudad de El Alto. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una maquina de coser, que le permita mejorar su producción y sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia H. lives in Alquiler, in the Pasankeri zone, on the west side of the City of La Paz. She is a seamstress who makes sportswear for an enterprise that provides the work material. Her husband is employed in a lathe shop in the City of El Alto.

The loan she solicits is to buy a sewing machine, which will permit her to improve production as well as her income.

This is the first time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis that has been done qualifies the couple favorably, enabling them to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A SEWING MACHINE TO IMPROVE PRODUCTION AND RAISE HER INCOME

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia YESSICA es una futura madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente y esta embarazada. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende desayuno almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir otro restaurante por el distrito de San Jerónimo quiere comprar sillas, mesas, platos, cubiertos y ollas.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yessica is a member of the commune bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” and a future mother. She is 21 years old, she lives in a partnership and she is pregnant. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has run this business for several years and very successfully, thanks to her hard work. This member of our commune bank is a working mother and a business woman, who takes care of her family. She requests a loan to open another restaurant in the San Jerónimo district; she needs to buy chairs, tables, dishes, pots and table sets. Yessica is very grateful for this opportunity and she is commited to fully repay the loan according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furnishing stuff for a new restaurant.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget A. has a stall where she sells groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She is working hard in her business so that her dream of having a supermarket will come to pass in the future. She is 40 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. Bridget hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Enosh

texts.en:
Enosh J. is a 27 year old man married to Varary J.. Together they have a two year old son. Enosh is a tailor and runs his tailoring business in Naivasha town.

This is Enosh’s third loan with KADET. With his first and second loans Enosh was able to establish his business in terms of acquiring better premises and buying sewing machines. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a client.

Enosh plans to buy textile stock in bulk in preparation for the Chrismas season which is normally a peak time in Naivasha. He will also use the loan to assist his wife in improving her vegetable business by adding more stock.  

Enosh currently pays rent but his longterm goal is to grow his business to be able to acquire his own premises.

loans.use: To buy a stock of fabric for his tailoring business

loans.name: Twekwatire Wamu Matumba Zaituni Group

texts.en:
Zaituni M.  is thirty-seven years old, married with seven children of whom six are in school. She is also taking care of four dependents who are orphans and schooling too. She sells new shoes to children and to both men and women. Zaituni will use the loan to purchase and improve stock . Zaituni is a very hardworking business woman whose future plan is to obtain enough capital to enlarge her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes for ladies, gents and kids.

loans.name: Manuel Leoncio

texts.es: Don Manuel Leoncio P.  conductor de una empresa privada, desde hace varios años. Con ayuda de su esposa lograron poner una pequeña comideria  en su casa para poder ayudarse económicamente ya que hay que pagar varios gastos básicos y que no le ajusta con su salario. Su negocio, por las ventas bajas de la comideria la serró un tiempo ya que se quedaron sin fondos. Pero el desea volver a poner la comideria por que ya no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar es por eso con Este financiamiento lo invertirá en compras de manteles, utensilios nuevos para dar un mejor servicio a si como la compra de  granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, carnes, pollo, verduras y frutas para volver a preparar los alimentos variado del comedor y poder captar los clientes el cual espera recuperarse lo mas pronto. Don Manuel tiene 51 años de edad, sus planes es siempre apoyar a sus hijos aunque los cinco estén ya casados, a si como hacer mejoras a su casa, como refinar paredes para pintarla y darle otro ambiente familiar. Da las gracias Afodenic por hacer posible poder invertir en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Don Manuel Leoncio P. has been working as a driver for a private company for many years. With the help of his wife, he established a small diner in his home. This business has helped them financially and has allowed them to pay several basic expenses that normally they would not be able to cover on his salary alone.
