Due to low sales and a lack of funds, Don Manuel closed his business temporarily. He wants to reopen the diner, but he is not able to do so because he cannot cover his household expenses.

For this reason, he has requested a loan to purchase linens and new utensils to help him provide better service. He will also buy basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, vegetables, and fruits for preparing the various dishes that his diner previously offered. Don Manuel hopes to recapture his customers and recover quickly. He is 51 years old and always plans to support his children, even though all five of them are already married. Likewise, he plans to make improvements to his home, such as painting the walls to provide his family with a different atmosphere. He thanks AFODENIC for making it possible to invest in his small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase utensils, linens, and ingredients

loans.name: Juliver Gil

texts.es:
El socio JULIVER GIL es un futura padre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

El socio tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y su esposa Jessica esta embarazada. Ellos viven en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. El y su esposa tienen un pequeño restaurante donde venden desayuno almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabajan en el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 
Nuestro socio es una joven responsable y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para abrir otro restaurante por el distrito de San Jerónimo quiere comprar cubiertos y platos.  
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juliver Gil is a future father and a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura”. He is 26 years old and in a common law marriage. His wife Jessica is pregnant. They live in San Jerónimo District in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco.

He and his wife have a small restaurant where they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They have been in this business for several years and have done very well as a result of all the effort they put into their work. Juliver Gil is a responsible and enterprising young man who wants to succeed on behalf of his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase silverware and dishes so that he can open another restaurant in San Jerónimo District.

Juliver Gil is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silverware & dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Locks of Hair

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie is 41 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. Ivie sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in the market. She is happy with her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase her products.

Ivie is a client of LAPO which is an organization whose aim is to alleviate poverty in the lives of the people, especially women in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN (US$275) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marlyn Lissette

texts.es: La joven Marlyn M. se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, lleva cinco años en este negocio que inicio con una ayuda que su esposo dio para que ambos se apoyaran, producto de su trabajo de albañil. Anteriormente solo vendía por encargos como la clientela ha aumentado y no puede cumplir con los pedidos por que no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar ropa y cosmético ya en zapato invertio casi todo su dinero. Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para hacer crecer su negocio y poder sastifacer a sus compradores ya que desea aprovechar las ventas de esta época navideña que espera deje buenas ganancias. Sus meta como madre es poder tener su propia casa ya que viven en un cuarto de la mama de su esposo, que es pequeño y muy inseguro por que esta forrado con zinc una parte. Solo tiene una niña de cinco años el cual espera poder dar una vivienda digna que espera poco a poco junto a su esposo lograr construirla junto con el apoyo de la institución que espera tenerlo.
texts.en:
Marlyn M. is a young woman who has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for five years. She started her business with the help of her husband, who works as a mason. They both support one another. Marlyn previously sold only by request, but now that her clientele has grown, she does not have sufficient funds to buy clothing and cosmetics to fulfill her orders. She invested almost all of her money into buying shoes. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business and satisfy her buyers. She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to generate more sales in hopes of earning better profits.

Her goal as a mother is to have her own home. She currently lives in her mother-in-law’s house, which is small and insecure because it is partially lined with sheets of zinc. Marlyn has a five year old daughter and hopes to provide her with a decent home. Over time, she and her husband hope to build a house with the support of AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & cosmetics

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es:
El señor Sotero B. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le pudo construir la recamara de su hijo. 
Le está haciendo falta un pequeño cuarto que será el baño ya que el que tiene actual mente esta en malos condiciones y tiene miedo que les pueda pasar algo a su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando nueva mente su cooperación para este crédito. Planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de cargas y descargas, y en las tardes se dedica a vender Hot Dogs con estas ganancias cubrirá los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sotero B. is very grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan, which he used to build a bedroom for his son. He needs a small room to be the bathroom. The one he currently has is in bad condition, and he is afraid that something could happen to his family. That is why he is asking again for your cooperation with a new loan. He plans to pay it with the income he gets from his work in the loading and unloading department of a transportation company. In the afternoons he sells hot dogs. These earnings will cover the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells babies' clothes and cream at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Her customers are mainly expectant mothers and nursing mothers.  Her desire is to become a major distributor of these products in the future. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits at this time.  She is applying for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more inventory to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more babies clothes and cream to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Luisa M. mujer esforzada, labora en servicios domésticos desde hace once años el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa, pero le hace falta mucho aun  no tiene piso, falta el repello de las paredes de la casa, también cambiar el techo que esta malo, en el invierno se le pasa el agua, anteriormente tenia letrina pero compro un inodoro que lo ubico junto con el baño pero que aun no tiene paredes ni piso el baño y cuando llueve se moja, y las condiciones sanitarias no son las adecuadas
Solo esta forrado con zinc, muy inseguro para el aseo personal, además tiene miedo que se metan a robar el inodoro a como esta la delincuencia en su barrio, tiene 48 años de edad, su esposo es carpintero y sus tres hijos están mayores. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para hacer el baño y poder cerrar el inodoro también a si como comprar una ventanas para la casa que están solo tapada con mantas que por gracias a Dios no le han robado nada todavía. Contenta por este represtamo ya que ha logrado poder hacer mejor sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa M. is a hard-working woman. She has worked in domestic services for 11 years. This has enabled her to make improvements to her house. But, she still does not have a floor, the walls are not plastered, and the bad roof needs to be changed because it leaks in the winter. She previously had a latrine, but she bought a toilet. She put it in the bathroom, but there still are no walls or flooring in the bathroom. When it rains, it gets wet. It has inadequate sanitary conditions. It is only covered with zinc, which is very unsafe for personal hygiene. Also, she is afraid that someone will steal the toilet because there is delinquency in her neighborhood. She is 48. Her husband is a carpenter, and her three children are adults. With this loan she will buy construction materials like stones, sand, cement, and iron to make the bathroom and enclose the toilet. She will also buy windows for the house; they are now covered with blankets. Thank God that nothing has been stolen yet. She is happy with this loan because she has been able to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stones, sand, cement, and iron to make the bathroom and enclose the toilet for better hygiene

loans.name: Emma Gloria

texts.es:
La socia EMMA es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijas mujeres. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene una  chacra donde cultiva pasto (comida para cuy) y distribuye a señoras que venden en su propio domicilio. La socia también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más semilla y aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda comprando mas comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Emma is a humble mother. She belongs to the Virgen Purificada – Angostura Communal Bank. She is 47, married, and has four daughters. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is south of the city of Cusco. She has a farm where she grows grass (food for guinea pigs), and she distributes it from her own home to the women who sell it. She also has a small grocery store. She has worked in the business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs a loan to buy more seeds and to increase her business capital in the store. She will buy more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more seeds and buy more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Don Manuel V. se desempeña como mesero  en un hotel capitalino elaborando por quince años, cuando entro al hotel  entro como eventual y por gracias a Dios logro quedar fijo, tiene 58 años de edad, junto con su esposa lograron hacer su casa pequeña y de concreto, pero con los años la madera del techo esta podrida y desea cambiar la solera ya que es una necesidad muy urgente, no solo por que en estado de invierno se moja si no que tiene miedo que su techo caiga por que esta con comejen la madera. Es por eso solicita el financiamiento para pode comprar perlin y zinc para poder cambiar su techo, y dar una mejor seguridad a su familia. Su hijo tiene 10 años de edad y cursa la primaria en el colegio de su barrio que espera sea un hombre de bien. También  quiere comprar las ventanas y puertas ya que están muy inseguras y teme que se le metan a robar. Todo esto que hará agracias al préstamo de la institución que a muchas familias traen mejoras a su vivienda como a su vida personal.
texts.en:
Manuel has worked as a waiter in a capital hotel for 15 years. He began there as a temporary but, thank God, he became a permanent worker. He is 58 years old and he and his wife built their little concrete house. But over the years, the wooden rafters have become rotten and he wishes to install a new roof. It is an urgent necessity because not only will it be water saturated in the winter but it might fall due to wood moth damage.

For this reason he is soliciting financing to buy construction board and zinc in order to replace the roof and provide greater security for his family. Also, they want to buy windows and doors since the house is very insecure and they risk robbery. His son is 10 years old and enrolled in the neighborhood primary school and they expect him to become a solid person. All this is made possible thanks to the community banking institution which has brought improvements to many homes and individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ROOFING MATERIALS, WINDOWS, AND DOORS TO MAKE THEIR HOUSE SECURE

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 30 is years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a policeman and also supports the household.  She sells cooking oil, snails, and coconut to make a living. With these combined businesses, she is able to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. The demand for her cooking oil is high because it is an essential ingredient in the preparation of Nigerian foods.  She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: María De Los Angeles Juanita

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles Juanita se le reconoce por ser buen cliente ya va por su  tercer crédito. Es una mujer emprendedora que no le gusta depender de sus hijos. Ella ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, ropa y juguetes también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. La casa donde vive se ha pasado de generación en generación ya que esta fue dada a su padre y luego a ella.
La casa esta muy deteriorada es por ello que quiere reconstruir las paredes, para recibir a sus vistas en esta navidad y darles mejor confort.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles Juanita is recognized as a good client and she is applying for her third loan. She is an enterprising woman who doesn't wish to depend on her children. For 8 years she has dedicated herself to selling food, clothes, and toys. She also depends on the help of her husband. The house where she lives has been passed down from generation to generation: it was given to her father and later to her.

The house is very deteriorated and for this reason, she wishes to reconstruct the walls, so she can receive visitors this Christmas and offer them greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO RECONSTRUCT HER HOUSE

loans.name: Etanislao

texts.es: Don Etanislao O., tiene su propio negocio de acarreo de la ruta de Managua a San Carlos, a muchos kilómetros de la capital, en su propio camión que logro comprar después que lo indemnizaron producto de un choque en su trabajo anterior, cuando viajaba en el bus y casi pierde la vida, fase muy difícil en su vida que poco a poco ha venido a asimilando, tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos al dominio de el y junto a su esposa. Por gracias a Dios ha logrado construir su casa aunque le falta mucho, el  repello de paredes, piso, divisiones pero que no le es de urgencia como la construcción del baño ya que lo tiene forrado de plástico negro y es inseguro e incomodo para todos mis hijos, pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacer esta mejora que es cerrar el baño como comprar el inodoro ya que desea cerrar la letrina para una mejor higiene en su casa. Para esto comprara cemento, arena, piedra, hierro y hará posible hacer esta obra que es de gran necesidad para todos. Con los viajes puede dar la alimentación a su familia pero no ha logrado ahorrar lo suficiente ya que todo esta caro y cubre todos los gastos solo el. Solo a gracias al financiamiento de la institución esta logrando la construcción.  Sastifecho por el plazo ya que solo así las personas de poco recurso podemos salir adelante en cubrir las necesidades de vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Etanislao O. has his own cargo business in which he travels between Managua and San Carlos. He drives several kilometers to the capital in his own truck, which he bought using the settlement money he received as a result of an accident he suffered when he was at his previous job. Don Etanislao was traveling by bus when he almost lost his life. It was a difficult time in his life and it took awhile before everything could return back to normal. He is 37 years old and lives at home with his wife and four children.

Thanks to God, he was able to build a house but it is far from being completed. The walls have to be plastered, a floor has to be installed, and dividers need to go up, but the most urgent necessity is the construction of a bathroom. The space being used at the moment is lined with black plastic and is both unsafe and uncomfortable for the children. Don Etanislao currently lacks the money needed to enclose the bathroom and install a toilet to provide better hygiene in his home. He plans to buy cement, sand, stone, and iron so that the work can proceed for everyone’s benefit. Through his cargo business, Don Etanislao is able to feed his family. Since he is the only family member generating income, he has not been able to save enough for anything that is expensive. Funding from the Institution is the only way construction could ever be possible. Paying back in installments is the only means by which people of low income are able to successfully take care of their housing necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector Monterrey del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al transporte de carga y de pasajeros en su mototaxi desde hace seis años. También se dedica a la agricultura pero esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes para sustentar a su familia por lo que todos los días trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde en su vehículo para sacarlos adelante.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil durante todo este tiempo ha hecho que algunas piezas de su motor empiecen a fallar por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en gastos de reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Jesús sueña con hacer mejoras en su casa que está construida de material rústico. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jesús is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in the Monterrey sector, district of Paiján, Ascope province, Libertad region, 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús has worked transporting cargo and passengers in his mototaxi for six years. He also does farming, but this does not provide enough income to sustain his family. So everyday, he works from six in the morning to four in the afternoon in his vehicle. Because of this constant use, some parts of the motor have begun to fail. Jesús needs a loan of 1000 soles for the costs of repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

Jesús dreams of making improvements to his house, which is made of rustic materials. This is the second time his has worked with this lending institution, and he has demonstrated that he is responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Basic Food Products

loans.name: Isabelle Dessimé

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame qui est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’attiegou qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Son mari est un conducteur de taxi moto, afin de l’aider dans les charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de maïs qui est une céréale très utilisée par les togolais dans leur alimentation. Pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle  s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à Anié. Voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 17 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Isabelle Dessimé G. is a married woman and mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in the outlying Attiegou quarter of Lomé village. Her husband drives a motor taxi. To help support her family, Isabelle started trading maize, a grain Togolese people often use in their food. In order to make a larger profit margin on her sales, she buys her supplies inland in Anié. Wishing to increase her stock, she is asking for a WAGE loan to buy 17 sacks of maize.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Sacks of Maize

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor Manuel Rivas, su negocio es la venta de repuestos con más de ocho años en las ventas,  anteriormente trabajaba en ventas y ganaba por comisiones, luego con préstamo en financiera logro poner su venta de repuesto poco pero ha logrado con los años invertir. Tiene su clientela pero muchas veces le da crédito y pasan meses para que le cancelen debido a que no le consiguen la paga total por las ventas baja de su negocio todo esto por la mala economía que esta atravesando el país. Y el queda mal también con sus gastos por pagar. Con esta solicitud de préstamo lograra hacer un muro en la parte de atrás para poder estar en mejores condiciones de seguridad ya que en el barrio que habita hay mucha delincuencia. A si como dar a sus dos hijos que tiene una mejor vivienda, como una mejor educación. Todo esto por el apoyo que la institución ha dado mediante su financiamiento.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel Rivas has been selling replacement parts for over eight years. He previously worked in sales and earned by commission. Then he used a loan to set up a small business selling replacement parts. Through the years he has been able to invest in it. He has customers, but he frequently gives them credit. Months pass before they are completely paid. Sales are down in his business. This is all due to the bad economy, which has covered the country. He is not doing well with the expenses he has to pay, either. That is why he is asking for a loan to build a wall in the back. He will do this to be able to improve his security conditions. There is a lot of delinquency in his neighborhood. This way he will give his two children a better home and a better education. All of this is because of the support the institution has given him through the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron to build a wall in the back of his house

loans.name: Komlagan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire dynamique qui pour subvenir à ses propres besoins s’est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce de cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et ILLICO en gros et en détail. Il dispose déjà de 2 ans d’expérience professionnelle, ce qui lui permet d’avoir une maîtrise de son commerce. Actuellement son stock est en baisse raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 25 cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et 25 cartes de recharge ILLICO
texts.en:
This gentleman is a young, energetic, and unmarried man who, to provide for himself, embarked on a retail and wholesale business in 2007 selling TOGOCEL and ILLICO mobile phone recharge cards. He already has two years of professional experience, which enables him to have a command of his commerce. Currently, his inventory is low. This is why he's requesting a loan from WAGES, so as to stock up again with 25 TOGOCEL recharge cards and 25 ILLICO recharge cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mobile phone cards

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, es una cliente desde el año 2004, ella comenzo con el grupo solidario Buen Samaritano, y luego con el grupo Diamante en doce secuencias, posteriormente se individualizo; siendo  este credito su tercera secuencia con este crédito individual, es una cliente muy trabajadora, ya que antes de fallecer su esposo, ella se dedicaba a la mantención de su hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos, ellos son menores de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella con los créditos que sacó se fue comprando bienes para su hogar,y para el negocio, vive en la casa de su mamá, tiene buenas referencias de los vecinos, es una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Sonia has been a borrower since 2004. She began as part of the Buen Samaritano group and later with the Diamante group for twelve cycles. She is now taking out loans individually. This is her third individual loan. She is a very hard worker, since before her husband passed away she was in charge of maintaining the household and educating her two children, who are still young and who attend school. With the previous loans she took out, she purchased goods for her house and for her business. She lives in her mother's house, has good references from neighbors, and is a good borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying bananas, plantains, and oranges

loans.name: Djamira

texts.fr: Cette dame est  une femme célibataire, très dynamique  qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle y a associé le commerce de galettes. Son stock de galettes a diminué, elle souhaiterait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 09 sacs d'arachide. C’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This lady, who is unmarried and very energetic, has a revenue-generating business for grocery items. She has included with it the sale of cookies. Her inventory of cookies has diminished. She would like to stock up again. This is why she's requesting a loan from WAGES, so as to buy nine sacks of peanuts. She supports herself with the income from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cocoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying health care supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying hair extensions

loans.name: Yao Bernard

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a fait une formation en cuisine, après sa formation il a ouvert son propre restaurant qu’il a appelé « FREEDOM FAST FOOD », beaucoup de gens viennent manger chez lui car il fait de la bonne cuisine. Actuellement les produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration étant épuisés, il s’adresse à WAGES pour acheter 2 bidons d’huile, un panier de tomates, 2 sacs de riz  et divers autres produits.Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman took training in cooking.  Afterward, he opened his own restaurant he called "FREEDOM FAST FOOD".  Many people come to his place to eat because he makes some good food. Currently, the items necessary for his restaurant business are out of stock, so he is inquiring with WAGES to buy two drums of oil, a basket of tomatoes, two sacks of rice, and a variety of other goods.  He is married and the father of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, tomatoes, sacks of rice, and various other goods

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia V. mujer trabajadora desde su juventud, había deseado tener su propio negocio el cual es una pulpería que con ayuda de su única hija han salido adelante, a pesar que la crió sola. Las dificultades en su negocio que ha dado crédito y mucha gente no le han pagado y ha venido descapitalizando su fondo como poco inventario,  es por eso desea invertir en granos básicos, cosmético como: vanidades, pinturas, sombras, pintura de uña, talco, colonia, a si como productos enlatados, para preparar los alimentos. El cual espera poder vender más y seguir aumentado de clientes. Con esto que le ha pasado no dará más al crédito ya que tiene una responsabilidad con la institución de pagar mensual, a si como pagar sus gastos básicos de agua, luz, teléfono.  Su anhelo es poder hacer crecer su venta para que a futuro su hija dependa de su negocio propio. Feliz por que solo mediante el financiamiento ha podido fortalecer su negocio  y solo mediante este medio se logra la inversión a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Julia V. has been a hard-worker since her youth. She had wanted to have her own business, which is a mini market. With help from her only daughter, they have gotten ahead in spite of the fact that she raised her alone. The problem with her business is that she has given credit, and many people have not paid. She does not have adequate funding, and she has little inventory. That is why she wants to buy basic grains and cosmetics like lipstick, shadow, nail polish, powder, and cologne. She also wants to buy canned goods to prepare food. She hopes to be able to sell more and get more customers. With what has happened, she will not sell anymore on credit. She has a responsibility to the institution to make monthly payments, and she has to pay basic expenses like water, light, and telephone. Her goal is to be able to make her sales grow so that in the future her daughter can depend upon her own business. She is happy that she has been able to strengthen her business with the loan. The loan is the only way to achieve long term investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and cosmetics and other products to increase sales through a variety of products

loans.name: Bouraïma

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  habite dans le quartier de cassanblanca au centre de la ville de Lomé, il est marié et père d’un enfant. L’activité qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de ruminants et de volailles. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et il réalise d’excellents chiffres d’affaire surtout en périodes de fêtes. La fête de fin d’année étant proche, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 25 ruminants et 42 volailles.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Cassanblanca district at the center of the city of  Lomé.  He is married and the father of one.  The work he does that enables him to provide for his family is the commerce of ruminants and poultry.  This business is going well for him, and he is realizing excellent sales figures, especially during holidays.  With the approach of the New Year celebrations, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 ruminants and 42 birds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ruminants and poultry

loans.name: Ruth Rocio

texts.es:
La socia ROCIO es una humilde persona que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella estudio cosmetología y actualmente esta haciendo sus prácticas profesionales en el Centro Educativo Ocupacional  “C.E.O. Divino Maestro”. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene anhelos de superación y requiere el préstamo para abrir un centro de belleza exclusivo para mujeres de bajos recursos quiere comprar tijeras, espejos y sillones.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member ROCIO is a humble person who belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. She is 25 years old, single, and without children. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is located to the south of the city of Cusco. She studied cosmetology and now is doing a professional internship in the Occupational Education Center “C.E.O. Divino Maestro”. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young woman who has dreams of overcoming her current challenges. She needs this loan to open a beauty salon that will exclusively serve low-income women; she wants to buy scissors, mirrors, and chairs. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through these means and therefore she promises to make all her payments according to her time line.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs this loan to open a beauty salon that will exclusively serve low-income women; she wants to buy scissors, mirrors, and chairs.

loans.name: Yngrid Vania

texts.es: La Sra. Yngrid Vania M. F. tiene 26 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y su menor hijo en casa propia de material noble ubicada en el Caserío de Sacta Distrito de Santiago. Perciben ingresos trabajando como obreros de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 3 años de experiencia. Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación lograron construir parte de su vivienda y comprar sus bienes. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yngrid Vania M. F. is 26 years old, lives with her husband and her young son in their own house made out of “material noble” (cement and brick) located in the Caserío de Sacta district of Santiago. They have been earning income working as rural laborers in an agro-industrial company for three years. She is seeking this loan to finish constructing her home which was damaged by the earthquake in 2007. Thanks to her effort and dedication, they were able to construct part of their home and buy some household goods. Her dream is to be able to construct the whole house with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. Both are thankful for the support that we have offer them through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Digna Noe

texts.es: La Sra. Digna Noe R. R. de 27 años de edad. Es madre soltera con un  hijo en edad escolar. Vive en casa de un familiar ubicada en el Caserío de Sacta Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia, es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que ha salido adelante. Requiere el crédito para construir su vivienda en esteras en un terreno que han cedido sus familiares. Su sueño es lograr construir su vivienda de material noble con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Digna Noe R. R. is 27 years old. She is a single mother with a young, elementary-school aged son. She lives in a relative's house located in the Caserío de Sacta district of Santiago. She has been working as a rural laborer in an agro-industrial company for two years. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who has been able to prosper financially. She needs this loan to build her house in a parcel of marshland that her family has given her. Her dream is to be able to construct her home out of “material noble” (cement and brick) with the goal of being able to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we have offered her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Akossiwa Nyawodo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 01 enfant, son époux est un transitaire, pour apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion de son foyer, elle a commencé depuis 2006 le commerce de pagnes et de tissus, ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle veut l’agrandir raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat d’une trentaine de pagnes Hi Target et 15 pagnes de marques Phoenix.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child.  Her husband is a shipping expediter.  To do her financial share in managing the home, she started a business in 2006 selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and fabrics.  This business is successful for her.  She wants to expand it.  This is why she's requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy about 30 Hi-Target pagnes and 15 Phoenix-brand pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying quality "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Patricia Del Pilar

texts.es: La Srta. Patricia Del Pilar P. S. de 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia de material noble y adobe ubicada en el Caserío de la Venta Alta Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial con 1 año de experiencia, es una persona trabajadora que no deja sus metas atrás porque también esta estudiando la carrera de control de plantas. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró reconstruir parte de su vivienda como también comprar sus artefactos. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Ms. Patricia Del Pilar P. S. is 24 years old, single, and lives in her own home made of “material noble” (cement and brick) located in the Caserío de la Venta Alta district of Santiago. She has been working as a rural laborer in an agro-industrial company for one year. She is a hard-working person who sticks with her goals because she is also studying the field of plant management. She needs this loan to finish constructing her house which was damaged by the earthquake of 2007. Thanks to her effort and dedication she was able to reconstruct part of her home and to buy its fixtures. Her dream is to be able to build her whole home with the goal of achieving a higher quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we are able to offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA Y PUNTUAL, EN SU HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DEMUESTRA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD, SOBRE TODO DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD; LA SEÑORA CRISTINA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES NUEVOS EN LA AVENIDA VICENTE OCHOA, EL NEGOCIO ES COMPARTIDO ENTRE SU ESPOSO Y ELLA, SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE LOS MUEBLES Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES, ELLOS EN LA ACTUALIDAD NO TIENEN NIÑOS,  EN SU TALLER DE CARPINTERIA TIENE UN AYUDANTE, PERO LA SEÑORA CRISTINA NO SOLO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES SINO TAMBIEN AYUDA EN LAS LABORES DE LA CARPINTERIA EN EL LIJADO Y EN EL BARNIZADO, SU TRABAJO ES SACRIFICADO PORQUE ELLA TIENE QUE LEVANTARSE MUY TEMPRANO PARA ATENDER A SU ESPOSO Y LUEGO REALIZAR LA VENTA DE SUS MUEBLES, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN A COMPRA DE DE MADERA POR MAYOR, AL REALIZAR LA COMPRA POR MAYOR LOS COSTOS LE SALEN MAS BARATOS.
texts.en:
This woman is an old and punctual client; her credit history demonstrates punctuality, responsibility, and above all a good attitude. Mrs. Cristina's business is the sale of new furniture in the Vicente Ochoa Avenue. This business is a collaboration between her and her husband; her husband is a carpenter and constructs the furniture while she focuses on the furniture sales. Right now, they don't have any children. In her husband's furniture workshop, he has an assistant, but Mrs. Cristina not only sell the furniture but also helps with the carpentry work – the sanding and the varnishing. Her work is very demanding because she to get up very early to help her husband and then begin to manage the furniture sales. This loan will be used to purchase wholesale wood, because purchasing wholesale is cheaper.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wholesale wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying jewelry for resale

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
Carmelina tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que viajara a trabajar al país de Chile. Hace un año regresó con el objetivo de trabajar en su país haciendo lo que más le gusta: cocinar. Fue así que instaló un restaurante en un local alquilado a un costado de la carretera Panamericana. Allí ella prepara diversos platos típicos que ofrece a los tranportistas, turistas y público en general que frecuentan la zona.

La clientela ha ido creciendo durante este tiempo gracias a su buena sazón y buen trato. Carmelina desea preparar más platos para hacer crecer su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de platos típicos.

Carmelina nos comenta que su sueño es poder establecerse en un local propio y que ya está trabajando en ello. Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
54-year old Carmelina is married and has four children. She and her husband live in Paiján district, Ascope province, in the region of La Libertad, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. In order to provide for her family, Carmelina used to have to travel to Chile to get work. She returned a year ago to work in Peru doing what she most enjoys: cooking. She opened a restaurant in rented premises located on the the Panamerican highway. There she cooks a variety of traditional meals for truck drivers, tourists, and the general public. The number of customers has been increasing over the year because of the tasty food and good service. Carmelina wishes to prepare more dishes so that her business can grow, but she lacks the necessary capital. She has applied to Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles to purchase ingredients. Carmelina says that her dream is to open a restaurant in premises that she herself owns and she is working towards fulfilling that dream. Carmelina has been a client of Edpyme Alternativa before and shown herself to be responsible in the repayment of her loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making traditional foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying pagnes

loans.name: Luz En Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Joaquina, 50, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz en Desarrollo (Developing Light), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Joaquina has a small business selling home decorations to her friends and the people in her neighborhood. With this loan, her very first with Esperanza International, she will be purchasing Christmas decorations to sell at a small markup. She also buys fabrics, bathroom decorations, and other types of interior decorations to sell to her customers. In addition to buying more inventory, Joaquina will purchase a new fan for her business so that it is more comfortable for her customers.

Joaquina, her husband, and her children live in a difficult area. Los Alcarrizos can be a tough place to live with no potable running water, little access to electricity, and poor sanitation. Despite those difficulties, Joaquina is optimistic for the future. She believes that with the support of extra business profits, her children will now be able to do whatever they would like with their lives. Joaquina also would like to continue expanding her business, buying equipment and moving to a larger store. Thank you for your loan to Joaquina and the Luz en Desarrollo group!

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: Kossi Mawuyanya

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris la mécanique et s’est spécialisé dans l’électricité auto. Il a ouvert en 2006 son atelier dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Il n’est pas marié et n’a pas non plu aucun enfant à sa charge. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Il en profite également pour vendre des batteries d’alimentation auto à ses clients. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient la rapidité et la qualité de ses services. Pour commander ces batteries, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de lancer cette demande.
texts.en:
This man learned mechanics and became specialized as an automobile elctrician. He opened his own shop in 2006 in the Adidogomé district. He is not married and has no children to support. This business enables him to meet most of his needs. He takes advantage of his shop to sell automobile power batteries to his customers. Many of his customers appreciate the speed and quality of his services. To order these batteries, he's requesting a WAGES loan that will allow him to initiate an order.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying power batteries for automobiles

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es: El señor Heliodoro López, desde hace doce años se dedica a la agricultura, con sus propios esfuerzos logro establecerse una manzana de café, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los recursos económicos para darle el mantenimiento que requiere la producción, un de los factores que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden, con el financiamiento va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para inducir.  Don Heliodoro habita en un barrio pobre de la Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como agricultura y comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos básicos de agua, luz y otros gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos de 25 ,20 y 16 años, los mayores ya son casados e independiente, el de 16 años actualmente estudiante de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es apoyar en sus estudios a su pequeño y darle una mejor condición de vida para que sean un hombre de bien. Agrade por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de los fondos Kiva; ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician y logran optar por un mejor bienestar ya que la crisis económica por la  que enfrenta el país, no le permite trabajar con sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Señor Heliodoro López has worked as a farmer for twelve years and through hard work now has a plot of land on which he grows coffee. The biggest problem he faces is lack of money to keep production high. For example, insects and disease are a constant problem. As well, he needs cash to buy fertilizer and other items to help the plants grow. Heliodoro and his wife live in a poor neighbourhood called Concepción Masaya. She works as a farmer and businesswoman to help with basic household expenses such as water and electricity. They have three children aged 25, 20, and 16 years. The oldest two are already married and independent; the 16-year old is currently a secondary school student. Heliodoro wishes to help him with his education and give him a better life so that he can become a man of standing. Heliodoro is grateful to Kiva and its partner Afodenic for the loans which have benefitted many families and given them a better standard of living. Because of the economic crisis that the country faces, he would not be able to find the necessary resources to work his land without help.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer etc for his coffee plants

loans.name: Roel

texts.es: El Sr. Roel C. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de adobe junto a su esposa y su menor hija en el Caserío  San Antonio. Se dedica a labores de campo en una empresa Agrícola de la zona, además su esposa lo apoya laborando de forma informal en parcelas de sus vecinos dedicándose además a crianza de animales. Su casa es de adobe y caña por lo cual se vieron afectados por el terremoto con lo cual han solicitado ayuda y han accedido al beneficio de la construcción de un módulo de vivienda para lo cual necesitan de un financiamiento para concluir con el techado y demás acabados. Son personas muy trabajadoras cuyo sueño principal es lograr tener su casa construida para gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le podamos brindar para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
30-year old Roel C., his wife, and youngest daughter live in their own adobe house in Caserío San Antonio. He works as a farm labourer in an agricultural business while his wife helps out by working as a casual labourer on their neighbours’ land. She also raises animals. As their house is made of adobe and reeds, they are often affected by earthquakes. They asked for help with the house and a new home has been built. Now they need a loan for roofing etc so they can finish the house. They are very hardworking people whose dream is to have their house completed so they can enjoy a better quality of life. They are both grateful for the financial help that enables them to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to complete his home

loans.name: Akouvi Florence

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la coiffure et en 2004, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion de son foyer. Ses clientes apprécient la qualité de ses services ; elle en profite pour vendre aussi des mèches à des prix concurrentiels. En ce moment elle a besoin d’acheter des mèches et tissages pour renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This woman learned how to style hair, and in 2004 she opened her own salon in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.  This business enables her not only to support herself but also to do her financial share in managing her home.  Her customers appreciate the quality of her services;  she uses this advantage to sell hair extensions too, at competitive prices.  At this time, she needs to buy some hair extensions and weaves to replenish her low inventory.   For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES.  She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et assume seule l’éducation scolaire de son enfant. Elle a appris la coiffure ; malheureusement, ce métier ne lui rapporte pas comme elle le souhaite. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a décidé en 1989 de se lancer dans la vente de pagnes de qualités et des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Avédji à Lomé, dans son atelier de coiffure. Elle vend également des sacs de sortie pour dames. Ce nouveau commerce lui rapporte bien et elle se réjouit donc de cette nouvelle activité. C’est pour renouveler son stock en baisse en ce moment qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes et certains produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow, and she assumes sole responsibility for educating her child.  She has learned how to style hair.  Unfortunately, this trade did not bring in what she wished from it.  For this reason, she decided to embark on the sale of quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and cosmetics in 1989 in the district of Avédji in Lomé, there in her hair salon.  She also sells women's purses.  This new business is gainful for her, and so she is delighted with it.  To replenish her diminished stock at this time, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy some pagnes and certain cosmetic products. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying "pagne" cloth and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Leonor Aurora

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su madre y su hija de siete años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años compró una fotocopiadora para ampliar un negocio de cabinas de internet que funcionaba en su casa. La idea del negocio nació debido a que originalmente existían pocos establecimientos de ese tipo por la zona y que resultaba de gran ayuda para los estudiantes del lugar. Con estas actividades ella ha venido sosteniendo a su familia durante todo este tiempo.

El tiempo de uso que tiene la fotocopiadora ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Leonor es una mujer activa y luchadora. Ella sabe que para progresar debe seguir trabajando por lo que día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante y cumplir con su mayor anhelo: ver a su hija convertida en un excelente profesional. 

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 34 year old, single mother who lives with her mother and her 7 year old daughter in the Paiján district in the Ascope province which is in the La Libertad region three hours from Chiclayo. Two years ago she bought a photocopy machine to improve her internet cafe business which she runs from her home. Her business idea came from the fact that originally there were very few businesses of this type in her area and it turned out that it was a great help to the neighborhood students. Through this activity she has been able to support her family this whole time. She has used this photocopy machine for so long that it has begun to suffer small problems that need quick repair. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative. Leonor is an active and fighting woman. She knows that to progress she needs to keep working, so every day she finds the energy to move forward and achieve her greatest desire: to see her daughter become an excellent professional. She has worked with us before and was very responsible and repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses related to repair and maintenance of a photocopy machine

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro Velásquez V. , es una mujer que se dedica a los trabajos de campos desde hace mas de 17 años , gracias a apoyo que brindo la reforma agraria obtuvo un terreno el cual con sus propios esfuerzos logro establecer una manzana de piña , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para darle los mantenimientos correspondiente al cultivos ya que estos se ven afectados por las plagas , si ella logra aplicar todos los fertilizantes necesarios podrá tener una buena producción pagar el desembolso y con las ganancias mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , doña Celia , habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar ; ellos tiene tres hijos actualmente estudiante de secundaria el cual espera poder ayudar con sus estudios para que no dependan solo de la agricultura por que muchas veces no se logra lo esperado por la sequía oh cuando no se tienen los recursos necesarios.
texts.en:
Señora Celia del Socorro Velásquez V. is a woman that has been dedicated to field work for more than 17 years. Thanks to the support that the agrarian reform offered, she obtained land and with her own efforts she managed to establish a pineapple farm. The most difficult problem for her is that she does not have sufficient capital to maintain her crops, since they are affected by plagues. If she manages to apply all the necessary fertilizers she will be able to have a good crop to repay the loan and provide profits to improve the conditions of her dwelling. Señora Celia lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband who works as a security guard. She supports him in providing for the expenses of the home. They have three children, presently in secondary school, who she hopes to be able to help with their studies so that they will not depend solely on agriculture, since many times it does not produce as expected due to drought or when they do not have the necessary resources.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the production of her pineapple farm

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme est célibataire mais a un enfant à sa charge. C’est une artiste de la chanson ; parallèlement à ce métier, elle est gérante d’un débit de boisson dans le quartier de Protestant à Lomé. Ce bar est visité par de nombreux clients à cause du bon accueil qu’elle leur réserve en tout temps. Elle a un besoin urgent de commander des casiers de boissons manquants dans son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour respecter son échéancier de remboursement.
texts.en:
This woman is single but has one child to support. She is a singer; at the same time she is the manager of a bar in the protestant area of Lomé. This bar is used by a large number of customers as a result of the warm welcome she gives them at all times. She urgently needs to order crates of drinks that are missing from her stock; it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES. She is not worried about being able to adhere to the terms of her repayment schedule.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: Dédévi

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la coiffure ; en 1997, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier de Bè Kpéhénou à Lomé. Son atelier est visité par de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de ses services. Elle a aussi à son service des apprenties coiffeuses. Elle en profite aussi pour vendre des mèches ; en ce moment elle a besoin de disposer d’un nouveau séchoir ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt lui permettra également d’acheter 2 grands miroirs, 30 serviettes et 40 mèches. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has trained as a hairdresser; in 1997 she opened her hairdressing studio in the Bè Kpéhénou area of Lomé. Her studio is used by a large number of customers who appreciate the quality of her services. She also has trainee hairdressers working for her. In addition she takes advantage of her studio to sell hair extensions; at the moment she needs to buy a new hairdryer; it is for this reason she would like to have a loan from WAGES. This loan would also allow her to buy two large mirrors, 30 towels and 40 hair extensions. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryer, mirror, hair extensions and towels

loans.name: Azalia Graciela

texts.es:
la sra. Azalia Graciela Z. tiene una pulperia desde hace 1 año la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería y Variedades  "AZALIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos dependen su matrimonio, 3 estudian en la secundaria
y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli. 
La  Sra Azalia es una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superacion ya que es una madre soltera y como madre, quiere dar todo lo mejor para sus hijos para que ellos se preparen y sean personas de bien en su vida. 
Su negocio le genera los recursos finanacieros para cumplir con las obligaciones en el hogar. Gracias a este credito el negocio de ella crecera un poco mas.
texts.en:
Señora Azalia Graciela Z. has had a convenience store for 1 year, which she operates under the name of "AZALIA Store and Varieties". Her business is located in her home. She is married and the mother of 4 children, all dependant on her. Three of her children attend secondary and primary schools of the city of Danli. Señora Azalia is a very enterprising woman who wants to improve herself, since she is now a single mother. As a mother, she wants to give the best to her children so that they will be prepared to be successful in their life. Her business provides her with the financial resources to meet the household obligations. Thanks to this loan seh will be able to grow her business a little more.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk products, juice, canned good, churros, bread, crackers, beans, butter, cheese, fat, margarine, oil, rice, coffee, toothpaste, toilet paper, soup, etc for resale in her convenience store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yasmina Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Yasmina P. L., desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura, ya que con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno para trabajarlo y de esa manera tener un ingreso, en estos últimos años la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la parte económica para poder comprar fertilizante e insumos necesarios para la aplicación de fertilizantes, doña Yasmina habita en el barrio Los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad  para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos de 18,15 y 9 años , la hija mayor ya es casada e independiente , los planes hacia su familia es apoyarlos con sus estudios y darle un mejor bienestar .Agradece a la institución por la confianza que le brinda a pesar de la dificultad que se le presento en el ultimo crédito que no logro pagarlo en tiempo y forma , por problemas de inducción y la producción no maduro en el tiempo establecido y parte fue robada. Espera poder con esta producción obtener mejores ganancias para poder cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación como poder hacer algunas mejoras en los cuarto de la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Yasmina P. L. has been dedicated to agriculture for 21 years. With her own efforts she managed to buy land, work it and in that way to have an income. In these last few years the greatest difficulty that she has been presented is the lack of funds to be able to buy fertilizer and necessary supplies for the application of fertilizers. Señora Yasmina lives in the Los Ríos neighborhood, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She supports her husband, who works as a security guard, in providing for the household expenses. They have three children ages 18,15 and 9 years. The older daughter is already married and independent. Her plans for her family are to support them with their studies and to give them a better standard of living. She thanks the institution for the confidence that they show in her, despite the difficulty that she had repaying the previous loan on time, due to problems of induction, the crop that did not mature in the time established and the parts that were stolen. With this crop she expects to be able to obtain better profits, to be able to cover her needs for food and to make some improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the production on her farm

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra del Carmen Pérez, desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura, gracias al apoyo de su esposo, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es por la crisis económica por la cual enfrenta el país y eso hace que no logre comprar los insumos necesarios para poder mejor sus cultivos de piña, doña Sandra con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a la producción de piña , ya que si ella logra esto va a beneficiarse en lo económico para que el mismo cultivo pague el desembolso y con las ganancias poder ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco , ella habita en un barrio alejado del pueblo del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen cuatro hijos a su cargo los cuales estudian actualmente . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de los fondos Kiva, ya que son muchas  familias  logran una mejor vida con estos tipos de programa para el desarrollo del país .
texts.en:
Señora Sandra del Carmen Pérez has been dedicated to agriculture for 16 years. Thanks to the support of her husband, the greatest difficulty that she is presented is the economic crisis faced by the country which prevents her from buying the necessary supplies to be able improve her pineapple crop. With this loan Señora Sandra is going to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies for the adequate maintenance of her pineapple crop. If she receives this loan, she is going to benefit economically so that the crop will repay the loan and with the profits she will be able to improve her dwelling little by little. She lives in a neighborhood located far from the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her husband, who also works, and supports him with the expenses of the home. They have four children in their care, who all attend school at present. She thanks Afodenic for their support through the funds from Kiva, since there are many families who achieve a better life with these types of programs for the development of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her pineapple crop

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Concepción Torres le está haciendo falta un cuarto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
Doña concepción es madre de familia tiene a dos hijos pequeños a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor y desea ya tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de ropa por catálogos, este ingreso sera para pagar el crédito y que los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el dinero que le manda su marido que se encuentra en los Estados Unidos trabajando.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Concepción Torres needs another room, but at this time she does not have the necessary money to be able to carry out the improvement. Señora Concepción is a mother with two small children. She wants to give them the best and would like them to each have their own space in the house. She is dedicated to the sale of beauty products and clothes from catalogues. This income will serve to repay the loan. She will cover the family expenses with the money that is sent by her husband, who is working in the United States.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin to add a room to her home

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, es separado,  tiene una hija de nueve años de edad y vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, tiene un auto que cubre la ruta Paiján - Puerto Malabrigo y viceversa. Este negocio ha sido la fuente de ingreso que le ha permitido sustentar sus gastos familiares y sacar adelante a los que más quiere. Por lo que día a día se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.

Debido al constante uso su auto sufrió algunas fallas que lo dejaron inoperativo y que requieren de reparación urgente. José se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para reparar y mantener su vehículo ya que no cuenta con los recursos economicos para realizar esta acción. 

El es un hombre bastante trabajador y empeñoso. Su más grande anhelo es poder asociarse a una empresa formal de transporte con la cual pueda trabajar de manera más estable.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old, separated, and has a nine-year-old daughter. He lives together with his mother in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the region La Libertad, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He makes a living by transporting passengers in his car, covering the route from Paijan to Puerto Malabrigo and viceversa. This business has been the source of income that has allowed him to cover his family expenses and help the ones he loves the most get ahead. Therefore, each day he puts forth maximum effort in his job. Due to constant use, his car suffered a few defects that left it inoperable and in need of urgent repair. Jose sees it necessary to request for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to repair and maintain his vehicle, since he does not have the economic resources to carry out these actions. He is a very industrious and hard-working man. His greatest wish is to become associated with a formal transporation company, with which he can work in a more stable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his car

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es: El señor Daniel P. , es un hombre agricultor desde hace mas de 40 años , gracias al apoyo de sus padres y esposa que le brindaron un terreno para que lo trabaje , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los problemas de plagas ya que los cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos y esto provoco muchas perdidas , ahora quiere darle el mantenimiento adecuado para poder tener un mejor producto , con el préstamo va a comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para inducir , don Daniel habita en el barrio San Pedro , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa ella era de gran ayuda para él por que todo lo que sacaba de producto lo comercializaba , ahora ya no cuenta con este apoyo debido a la enfermedad de diabetes que sufre hace seis meses , hasta lograr perder tres dedos de su pies izquierdo , con el apoyo que cuenta es con su hija mayor que esta a cargo de todas las actividades del hogar. Ellos son tres hermanos todos independientes. Pero son una familia unida. Contenta con el financiamiento que la institución ha dado para mejorar su cultivo de pitahaya
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel P. has been a farmer for more than 40 years, thanks to the support of his parents and wife who provided him with a plot of land to work. The greatest difficulty presented to him is the problem of plagues, since the crops lack fertilizers and other materials, which causes great losses. Now he wants to give them adequate care to be able to have better products. With this loan he is going to buy the necessary fertilizers to achieve this goal. Daniel lives with his wife in the neighborhood San Pedro, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She was a great help to him, because everything he produced she would market. However, he no longer has this support, because she has been suffering from diabetes for six months, even losing three toes from left foot. He now counts on the support of his oldest daughter, who is in charge of all of the domestic chores. Although they are very independent, they are a united family and are content with the financing that this institution has given them to improve their cultivation of dragon fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve the cultivation of dragon fruit

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Don  Luís Alfonso C. ,es un hombre dedicado a los trabajos de campos desde hace 27 años , la mayor afectación que se le presenta durante este tiempo son los recursos económicos , para poder darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivo de piña ; ya que estos carecen de insumos y la fruta queda muy pequeña , si el logra inducir en tiempo y forma todo los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios logrará sacar un  producción de calidad , esto le beneficia por lo que da mas facilidad al vender la piña grande a mejor precio, lo cual obtendrá y mejores ganancias, y pagaría en tiempo de pago su crédito mejora las condiciones de vida para su familia . Don Luís habita en el barrio La Borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar en los gastos básico de agua, luz , ellos tiene cuatro hijos mayores  de edad,  todos habitan con él. Y trabajan con el en los  trabajos agrícolas . Agradece a la institución por la confianza y seguridad que le brinda a los agricultores para que saquen su producción en mejores condiciones y sean mejor pagadas.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alfonso C. has made a living as a farmer for 27 years. The greatest challenge that has been presented to him during this time is that of economic resources, to be able to provide better maintenance to his cultivation of pineapples, since they are lacking the necessary supplies and the fruit ends up very small. If in time he manages to implement the necessary fertilizers and supplies, he will be able to yield quality products. This would benefit him because it would be easier to sell large pineapples at a better price, thereby increasing his earnings. Also, he would pay off his loan on time and improve the quality of life for his family. Luis lives with his wife in the neighborhood La Borgona, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works as a merchant to support him with the basic domestic expenses, such as water and electricity. They have four older children, all of whom live with them and work with Luis in agriculture. He thanks this institution for the confidence and security that it provides farmers, so they can turn out their products in better conditions and be better paid.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to combat plagues and obtain better fruit

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mâmârkua Group

texts.en:
The official name of this group is “The Women´s Bank of Mâmârkua”. This group consists of eight women from the Suretka region near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. With this loan, Elizabeth, Lidiana and Elidieth will receive a loan to invest at their discretion. In the picture, Elizabeth is sitting in the chair in the bottom left corner. Lidiana is wearing bright red pants (3rd in from the right) and Elidieth is the second woman in from the right (wearing a turquoise shirt). These women have created The Women’s Bank of Mâmârkua as a formal way to support one another as guarantors of each other’s loans. This loan will be the group’s second with Fundacion Mujer.

The Mâmârkua Women come from a culture that values and praises the elements of nature as well as the wisdom of elders. The word “mâmârkua” signifies “flower” in their native language. Elizabeth, Lidiana and Elidieth are applying for loans of 200,000 colons each.

Indigenous rural areas such as Suretka are characterized by many difficulties such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education and lack of available financial services.

The Mâmârkua Women have adapted to their challenging situation through a communal initiative to create work for themselves by engaging in the cultivation and sale of plantains (similar to a banana but green and mainly used for cooking - a staple food in the region). For the group members, the responsibility of raising a family has fallen on their shoulders alone, rendering the revenue generated from plantain sales a vital source of income. Despite their entrepreneurial spirit, their efforts have been hamstrung, partly due to exclusion from the traditional banking system. This is where you, through Kiva’s lending model, can help.

Each woman has been allocated a parcel of land by the Costa Rican government, in Suretka, a region located in the province of Limon. The women use this land for the growing of plantains as well as other subsistence crops. An intermediary distributor comes to the rural village once a week to purchase plantains from the women. In a good month, each woman can earn up to 70,000 colons. The distributor sells the plantains in the closest large city, Limon. The plantains require nine months to reach maturity (one complete cycle).
 
The close proximity of the Suretka region to a river has resulted in a major challenge for the group. Every year, the women must cope with the inundation of their plantain crops during the rainy season. In these months, the river rises and drowns an unpredictable number of the agricultural crops which are the source of livelihood for the Mâmârkua Women and their families. 

To surmount the seasonal obstacle of the rising river, the women have decided to expand their fields of cultivation to areas further away from the water. Although this may seem a simple solution, the land is a jungle, ridden with trees and undesirable weeds that need to be cleared before anything new can be planted. The women lack the resources (labour, tools) to take on this work themselves. Your loan will enable the Mâmârkua women to clear and use their land more effectively. By providing capital, the group members will be able to invest in necessary resources to clear new areas of their land for harvest at a safer distance from the rising river.

The credit consultant who has been working with The Women´s Bank of Mâmârkua over the past two years compliments the group on their punctual repayments as well as on their responsible and organized nature. Your loan is a direct investment in the betterment of the lives of women living in a poor community of Caribbean Costa Rica. By lending to these proactive and hardworking entrepreneurs, you are enabling them to help themselves.

loans.use: To facilitate the clearing of land and the planting of crops

loans.name: Martha Lorena
