texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena B., desde hace quince años, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, el rubro que labora es el cultivo de piña, la mayor dificultad por la cual enfrentan son los recursos económicos , el cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos lo cual las plagas lo han invadido a la vez el humo del volcán  afecta  por que son tierras que quedan cerca de al volcán , ella quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes para proceder a inducirlo y recuperar lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro gracias al apoyo de sus mamá.  ella habita en un barrio rural del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos de doce y siete años , actualmente estudiante ,los planes hacia su familia es apoyarlo y mejorar las condiciones de vida . Doña Martha esta contenta por el apoyo que le brinda la institución ya que son muchas familias campesinas que se benefician con estos programas de desarrollo agrícola.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Lorena B. has been dedicated to agricultural work for 15 years. The production that she works on is the cultivation of pineapples. The greatest difficulty that she faces are the lack of financial resources. Her farm lacks fertilizers and supplies to combat the plagues that have invaded her crops. At the same time the smoke of the volcano affects her fields, because her lands are located close to the volcano. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve her crop and to recover that which she has achieved with a lot of effort thanks to the support of her mom. She lives in a rural neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband who works as a security guard, supporting him in providing for the expenses of the home. They have two children of twelve and seven years, who are students at present. The plans for her family are to provide support and to improve their living conditions. Señora Martha this happy with the support that the institution offers her since many rural families have benefited from these programs of agricultural development.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to kill the plague and improve her production of pineapples.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa R., desde hace 16 años se dedica al comercio, ya que con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener su pequeña pulpería, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que en estos últimos meses cuando se dirigía al mercado para hacer las compras de la semana fue asaltada y hasta se le presenta problemas en su pies derecho por la causa del mismo , ahora ella se siente un poco desesperada por que es madre soltera y ella es la que le lleva el sustento a sus hijas , con el financiamiento quiere comprar abarrotes , golosinas , juguetes , cosméticos , entre otras cosa . Ya que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá recuperar un poco lo perdido y apoyar a sus hijas Doña Maria habita en un barrio del municipio de ticuantepe, los planes hacia su familia es poder ampliar su vivienda y darle una mejor condición de vida. Contenta  por la aprobación de su tercer crédito ya que son muchas las madres solteras que luchan día a día para mantener el sustento de sus hijos. Todo gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic lo cual espera poder segur con los ciclos para mantener el equilibro en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Teresa R. has been dedicated to commerce for 16 years. With her own efforts she has managed to maintain her small store. The greatest difficulty that she is presented is that in these last months when she was going to the market to make the weekly purchases, she was assaulted and now she has problems in her right foot because of this. Now she feels a little desperate because she is a single mother and she is the only one who provides support for her daughters. With this loan she wants to buy groceries, cookies, toys, and cosmetics, among other things. With the profits obtained she will be able to recover a little that she lost and to support her daughters. Señora Maria lives in a neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe. The plans for her family are to be able to expand her dwelling and to give them better living conditions. She is happy with the approval of her third loan since there are many single mothers that fight day by day to provide a living for their children. All thanks to the financing of Afodenic she expects to be able to continue with the cycles to maintain a balance in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cookies, cosmetics and toys for her store.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
el sr. EUSEBIO G. M. cuenta con un centro de fotocopiado y un molino para moler maiz, operando bajo el nombre de FOTOCOPIAS Y MOLINOS  "MONTE CRISTO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de 
habitacion. Eusebio es casado y padre de 3 hijos, todos dependen de su matrimonio,  3 de ellos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli.
El  Sr. EUSEBIO tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 17 años de dedicarse a prestar este tipo de servicios, su preferible clientela estan satisfechos con su esmerada y fina atencion que les brinda.
Juntos con su esposa atienden este negocio el cual les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar y mantenimiento de su negocios.
ahora el esta solicitando el credito para comprar resmas de papel al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señor EUSEBIO G. M. runs a photocopy center and a mill to grind maiz, operating under the name of "MONTE CRISTO PHOTOCOPIES AND MILLS". His business is located in his house. Eusebio is married and the father of 3 children, all dependant on him and his wife. Three of his children attend the secondary and primary public schools of the city of Danli. Señor Eusebio has a lot of experience in the management of this type of business, since he has been dedicated to providing this type of services for 17 years. His regular clientele is satisfied with the careful and personal attention that he offers them. Along with his wife he attends this business, which generates for them the financial resources to supply the expenses inside the home and the maintenance of their business. Now he is requesting a loan to buy reams of paper wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reams of paper wholesale for his photocopy business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
la joven GLORIA AZUCENA S. se dedica a la venta de ice cream y conos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de  "LA GLORIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales todos dependen de su matrimonio y estudian en la escuela primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de Danli. 
La  Sra.Gloria  tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 2 años de dedicarse a prestar este tipo de servicios. Su esposo le ayuda a vender mientras ella cuida a sus hijos por las tardes, su negocio les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar.
ahora Gloria esta solicitando un credito para comprar ice cream al por mayor, por el motivo que ya vienen los dias de navidad y hay muchas fiestas y las personas compran bastante ice cream para estas ocaciones.
Gloria es una persona que tiene mucho espiritu de superacion.
texts.en:
The young GLORIA AZUCENA S. is dedicated to the sale of ice cream and cones. Her business operates under the name of "LA GLORIA" . Her business is located in her house. She is married and the mother of 3 children, of which all depend on her and her husband. They all attend the primary school of the public educational centers of the city of Danli. Señora Gloria has experience in the management of this type of business since she has been dedicated to providing this type of service for 2 years. Her husband helps her to sell while she cares for her children in the afternoons. Their business generates them the financial resources to supply the expenses inside the home. Now Gloria is requesting a loan to buy ice cream wholesale, motivated by the approach of Christmas and the many festivals when people buy a lot of ice cream for these occasions. Gloria is a person that has a lot of spirit of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ice cream, cones, napkins and water for her ice cream business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Santos R. se dedica  a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera, tiene mas de 11 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, su  hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan la educacion primaria, con los ingresos que le genera  este negocio suple todos los gastos familiares y otros compromisos. El credito que esta solicitando es para comprar madera que es la materia principàl para la elaboracion de muebles,  se aproxima la temporada lluviosa y esto le dificulta ya que no cuenta con madera seca y desatiende a su clientela, esto le ocasiona perdida de tiempo y de ingresos. 
Tambien cuenta con un molino donde ofrece los servicios de molienda de maiz nixtamalizado y cafe.
Santos R. nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que las ganancias que ha tenido antes las a invertido en comprar maquinaria y tiene bien establecido su taller de carpinteria. ahora solo necesita invertir en la madera para la fabricacion de sus muebles.
sus muebles los vende al credito.
texts.en:
Señor Santos R. is dedicated to the manufacture and sale of wood furniture. He has been dedicated to this type of activity for more than 11 years. He is married and the father of 4 children. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and the three younger attend primary school. With the income that his business generates, he provides for all the family expenses and other commitments. The loan that he is requesting is to buy wood which is the raw material for the making of furniture. The rainy season approaches and this complicates his business, since he can not rely on finding dry wood and often disappoints his customers. This causes him lost time and income. He also relies on the income from a mill where he offers the services of grinding coffee and nixtamal (maiz mixed with lime to improve the maleability of the flour). Señor Santos R. tells us that he is very happy since the profits that he had before were invested in buying machinery. His carpentry workshop is well established. Now he needs to invest in wood for the making of furniture. He sells his furniture to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cedar, mahogany, laurel and pine wood, varnish, nails and screws.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la señora Reyna E. G. vive en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, esta casada con el señor Jose 
Rosali Rodriguez el es taxista y tiene su propio taxi, los dos juntos colaboran con los gastos de 
la casa, doña Reyna se dedica a la comercializacion de cosmeticos y los fines de semana elabora comida y golosinas. Tienen casa propia.
sus ventas las realiza en empresas privadas y estatales en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de San Lorenzo
su deseo es que su hijo se gradue de sus estudios, Reyna esta solicitando el credito ya que necesita 
capital de trabajo para invertirlos en sus cosmeticos, navidad es una buena epoca para las ventas, muchas clientas de empresas compran para tener producto para varios meses.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna E. G. lives in the district Buena Vista Centro and is married to Señor Jose Rosali Rodriguez who is a taxi driver. Together they share the household expenses. Mrs. Reyna works in cosmetics sales and on the weekends she makes food and sweets. They own their own home. She makes her sales to private and public businesses in the different neighborhoods and districts in San Lorenzo. Her dream is that her children will graduate school. Reyna is requesting a loan due to her need for working capital to invest in her cosmetics. Christmas is a big season for sales and customers buy product to stockpile for a few months.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
la señora Suyapa C. M. tiene 36 años de edad,  esta casada y vive en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, Suyapa se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende productos de la canasta basica como ser frijoles, arroz, embutidos, pollo, café, etc.
 
la señora M. atiende su negocio y tambien hace los oficios de la casa, tiene dos hijos que trabajan y le ayudan.
Esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mas productos y asi surtir su negocio en esta epoca de navidad.
su sueño es tener un mercadito bien establecido y que tenga muchos productos a la venta.
texts.en:
Suyapa C. M. is 36, married, and lives in the Buena Vista Centro colony. Suyapa sells popular consumption products. She has a mini market, and she sells staples like beans, rice, sausage, chicken, and coffee, etc. Señora M. tends her business and also does the household chores. She has two children who work and help her. She is asking for a loan to buy more products to stock her business for this Christmas season. Her dream is to have a well established market, which has a lot of products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eggs, tortillas, beans, butter, cheese, chicken, beef, pork, shortening, oil, margerine, rice, sugar and sausages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
la señora Milagro C. M. tiene 33 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo. su esposo esta en los estados unidos. Milagro se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, granos basicos  y queso en su carro que lo maneja su hermano menor.
Su producto lo compra en tegucigalpa y lo distribuye desde que sale del lugar de donde compra hasta llegar a su lugar de origen San Lorenzo. aqui termina su producto.
esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año, esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas verduras y granos basicos para esta epoca que la demanda es mayor, los pedidos son mayores y requiere de mas capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Milagro C. M. is 33, married, and has one child. Her husband is in the United States. Milagro buys and sells vegetables, basic grains, and cheese. She uses her car, which her younger brother drives. She buys her product in Tegucigalpa. She distributes it from when she leaves the place where she buys it until she gets to the place where she is from, San Lorenzo. That is where she finishes with her product. She has been doing this for one year. She is asking for the loan to buy more vegetables and basic grains for this season when the demand is greater. Orders are greater, and she needs more working capital

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and cheese

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Glendi Carolina

texts.es:
Glendi es una joven  emprendedora  que vive con su madre y su mayoria de tiempo se dedica al negocio,  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer sus obligaciones en la casa y luego se va para el mercado a vender su ropa, Glendi es una joven soltera, su madre le ayuda a vender en el mercado
con el credito que esta solicitando va a crecer su negocio y va a tener mejores utilidades, mas ahorita que viene la navidad y muchas personas de escasos recursos compran ropa de segunda mano, ya que es de buena calidad y el precio es muy comodo.
este tipo de producto se vende muy bien en esta zona de Choluteca.
texts.en:
Glendi is a young entrepreneur who lives with her mother and spends most of her time engaged in her business. She wakes up at 5am to take care of her household duties and later goes to the market to sell clothing. Glendi is a single young woman. Her mother helps her make sales in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to grow her business so that she can generate better revenues. Right now Christmas is coming, and many low income people want to buy secondhand clothes because of the high quality and affordable prices. This type of product sells very well in the area of Choluteca.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of secondhand clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelida

texts.es:
Evelida Baquedno es una sra. viuda, vive con sus 3 hijos menores de edad se levanta las 5 de la mañana para preparar a sus hijos para enviarlos a la escuela y kinder. doña Evelida  se dedica a la venta de productos fabricados de plastico, tiene su negocio en el mercado de su localidad.
doña Evelida enviudo hace 4 años  y desde ese tiempo se a dedicado a ser padre y madre para sus hijos
y piensa que con el credito que esta solicitando va a ayudarle y tamabien  en hacer crecer sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Evelida Baquedno is widowed and lives with her three young children. She gets up at 5 in the morning to get her children ready and send them to school and kindergarten. Mrs. Evelida sells plastic products. Her business is located in her town's market. Mrs. Evelida has been widowed for four years. Since then she has been both father and son to her children. She thinks the loan she is asking for will help her and allow her to increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cups, plates, pots, buckets, silverware, bowls, straws, baskets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosibell Elias

texts.es:
Rosibell G. es una persona emprendedora, tiene 2 hijos que los manda todos los dias al kinder y a la escuela. Se levanta las 4 de la mañana para atender a sus hijos y luego atiende a sus clientes durante todo el dia pues vive en una zona que a las 5 de la mañana ya hay movimiento de personas.
Rosibell es una persona muy amable, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio cuando sus hijos estan de vuelta en las tardes y tiene que atenderlos y ayudarles a hacer las tareas de la escuela, tambien se pone a estudiar con ellos.
y piensa que con el credito que esta solicitando le va ayudar en su neogicio y tendra buenas ganancias, el credito lo ocupa para comprar pollos, frutas, carnes, mortadela jamon.
texts.en:
Rosibell G. is an enterprising person. She has 2 children that she takes to kindergarten and to school. She wakes up at 4 in the morning to help her children and later to attend to her clients all day; she lives in an area where people are moving around by 5 in the morning. Rosibell is a very kind person. Her husband helps her with her business when the children return in the afternoon and she has to take care of them. She helps them to do their homework and she also studies with them. She thinks that this loan that she is requesting will help her with her business and she will make a good profit. The loan will go towards the purchase of chicken, fruit, meat and cold cuts (bologna & ham)

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks, fruit, chorizo(sausage), bologna, ham

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel Sánchez, desde hace dos años y medio trabaja como guarda de seguridad, su salario es bajo y  no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción, don José es de poco recursos económicos,  con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de su esposa han construido parte de la vivienda, él quiere repellar la vivienda y hacer las divisiones de la misma ya que si logra hacer esto van a gozar de privacidad y comodidad para todos, los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarles siempre apoyo a sus tres hijo que actualmente estudian y la niña de 13 años le apoyo con las actividades del hogar y luego va a estudiar . Agradece a Afodenic, por el apoyo que le brinda ya que son muchas  familias que logran tener un mejor bienestar en su vida personal como en la economía.
texts.en:
Sr. José Ángel Sánchez has been working as a security guard for 2½ years. His salary is low, which means he is not able to purchase all of his construction materials at one time. Don José has few financial resources, but through his own efforts and the support of his wife, he has been able to build part of his home. He wants to plaster the walls and install dividers so that everyone can enjoy privacy and be comfortable. The plans for his family are to always support his three school-age children. His 13 year old daughter helps with the household activities before doing her homework. Don José thanks AFODENIC for providing assistance to many families so that they can experience greater wellbeing in their personal lives and with their finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to plaster the walls of his house & install dividers

loans.name: Ingrid Elizabeth

texts.es: doña Ingrid E. tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un negocio que es una mini puleria, es madre de 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta en la escuela, Ingrid se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para arreglar a su hijo y mandarlo a la escuela, luego atiende a sus clientes, su esposo le ayuda en su negocio por las noches, ya que despues de la cena se dedica a sus hijos y descanza un poco ya que todo el dia pasa trabajando. esta solicitando el credito para comprar mercaderia y surtir mas su negocio. su sueño es poder graduar a sus dos hijos de la universidad, quiere que sean profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Doña Ingrid E. is 35 years old. Her business is a small grocery store. She is the mother of two children and one of them attends school. Ingrid wakes up at 5 in the morning to get her son ready and send him to school. Later, she attends to her clients and her husband helps her with the business in the evenings. After dinner, she attends to her children and rests a little since she spends all day working. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise and to stock up her store more. Her dream is that her two children will graduate from university; she wants them to be professionals and good men.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, instant soups, pasta, churros, juices, sardines, batteries, matches, candles, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, eggs, beans, sugar, tortillas, bread, cookies, candy, soap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la sra. Opal Amparo Almendares se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, compra fardos de ropa que viene de estados unidos, este tipo de mercaderia es muy bien vendida en esta zona, siempre la ropa que viene en los fardos es ropa de marca que dura mucho.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que tiene muy buenos precios de venta, a veces las personas no tienen mucho dinero para comprar ropa nueva y optan por comprar ropa de segunda que les sirve igual como si fuera ropa nueva.
esta empezando con su negocio, pero cada dia que pasa esta vendiendo mas y las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes, desea comprar mas fardos de ropa y poder abastecerse de ropa para la epoca de navidad ya que para esos dias las personas compran mucho.
texts.en:
Sra. Opal Amparo Almendares sells used clothing. She buys clothes that come from the United States by the bundle. This type of merchandise sells very well in the area. The clothes always come in bundles and consist of name-brand products that are very durable.

Her customers prefer to buy from her because she offers very good prices. Sometimes people do not have enough money to buy new clothes, so they choose to buy secondhand clothing and treat it as if it were new.

Sra. Opal is just starting her business, but with each passing day, she sells more merchandise and customer demand keeps growing. She wants to acquire more bundles of clothing and take advantage of the Christmas season because people are buying more during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar A. trabaja como guardia de seguridad desde hace diecinueve años, un trabajo de dedicación para bríndale seguridad a otras personas, vive en un barrio de la capital en el cual se requiere de tener segura su vivienda para que no sufra de ningún robo, unas de su metas en terminar la construcción completa de su casa teniendo mejores condiciones de vida para su hogar. Con los bajos ingresos por su puesto se le ha hecho muy dificultoso construir su casa, mediante el financiamiento que le hemos brindado en el primer ciclo ha ido construyendo el muro de la parte trasera y con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, piedras y continuar la construcción de la pared del lado izquierdo de la vivienda. Obteniendo mayor seguridad y protección para su familia, cumpliendo unas de sus metas, demostrando que es un hombre capaz de alcanzar las metas puestas para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar A. has been working as a security guard for nineteen years, dedicated to providing safety to other people. Cesar lives in a neighborhood of the capital where one needs to have a safe house to prevent robberies. One of his goals is to finish the construction of his house to improve the living conditions inside the home. The low wages from his job have made it very difficult to finish the house, but with the loan we granted him in the first cycle he has begun constructing the back wall. With this loan he will purchase construction materials such as cement, iron bars, and stones, and continue the construction with the left wall of the house. By improving security and protecting his family, Cesar will achieve one of his goals and demonstrate that he is a man capable of improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, and cement to build a concrete wall for his house, in order to provide more security for his family.

loans.name: Gloria Soledad

texts.es:
la señora Gloria Soleadad S. tiene 63 años de edad, es maestra jubilada, y se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de coronas florales y todo tipo de arreglos florales, Gloria es viuda desde hace varios años, esta es su ocupacion y asi tambien se distrae ya que cada vez que se acuerda de su amado esposo se pone triste, de aqui ella obtiene ingresos para mantener su hogar y gastos personales.
tambien enseña a varias personas a hacer este tipo de arreglos cuando tiene tiempos libres los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Soledad S. is a 63-year-old retired teacher, now working making and selling floral crowns and all types of flower arrangements. Gloria has been a widow for years; sometimes she gets distracted because every time she thinks about her beloved husband she gets sad. From this business she earns enough income to maintain her home and pay for her personal costs. She also teaches various people how to make these floral arrangements when she has free time on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flowers, wire, sticks, dirt, and ornaments for the elaboration of floral arrangements.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariela Yaquelin

texts.es:
la joven Mariela Yaquelin O. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y es dueña de una pulperia que esta ubicada en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Pespire, su deseo es que su negocio sea cada vez mas grande y hacerlo un mercadito, desea mejorar su nivel de vida y asi poder casarce y formar una familia, Mariela esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir su negocio en esta temporada alta
y con ello obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
nos comento que se siente mu feliz ya que a su corta edad ya tiene su negocio propio y que le esta dando frutos. su mayor deseo es casarse y formar una familia.
texts.en:
The young lady Mariela Yaquelin O. is 21 years old, single and owner of a small grocery store located in the San Jose neighborhood of the city of Pespire. She wishes to grow her business into a larger store. She wants to improve her standard of living and thus be able to marry and start a family. Mariela is requesting the loan for the purpose of supplying her store for this busy season and wants to be able to increase her income. She commented that she was very happy to be able to have her own profitable business at such a young age. Her greatest wishes are to get married and have her own family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the convenience store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
El Señor Oscar Danilo Pavón O., Labora en mantenimiento y limpieza del Mercado Israel Lewite, el tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en ese lapso ha invertido  9 créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, ella es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Danilo Pavón O. works in cleaning and maintenance at the Israel Lewite Market (Mercado Israel Lewite). He has three children; two of them are school –age. He is single and has had loans with CEPRODEL for 7 years. In this period of time, he has invested 9 loans in making improvements to his home, with help from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The requested loan is to invest in the purchase of materials for remodeling his home’s roof and to pay for the labor, in order to give his children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: La Señora Gladys Martínez de 34 años de edad, mujer emprendedora tiene su venta de variedades, para mejorar los ingresos de su familia ya que procreo tres hijos los cuales tiene que apoyar junto con su esposo para que puedan cumplir con el plan de estudio para formarse  como personas de bien y con un mejor nivel educativo. Meta de la cual esperan darles a sus hijos, con la esperanza de incrementar cada día su negocio por que gracias a Dios captado  muchos clientes y ha tenido varios encargos para este mes pero por falta de dinero no logra cumplir con la demanda de sus encargo es por eso que con este financiamiento lograra la inversión en la compra de ropa, zapatos electrodomésticos. El cual espera alcanzar buenas utilidades gracias a su esposo que dio dinero para comenzar esta venta y con apoyo de la financiera esta logrando surtir su inventario como la captación de clientes. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda en hacer cuarto para cada uno de sus hijos y así no estén juntos para una mejor privacidad. Claro que poco a poco lo lograra por que todo esta caro y no se puede construir de una sola vez.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Martínez is 34 years old, an enterprising woman that sells varied products to improve her family income. She has three sons who together with her husband she needs to support so that they can continue their plan of study and become more successful persons with a better education. She plans to be able to attain this goal for her children with the hope of growing her business more each day. Thanks to God she has been able to get many customers this month and has several orders, but for lack of funds she cannot meet the demand of her orders. This loan will enable her to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes, small electric appliances. She is expecting good results, thanks to her husband who gave her money to start this sales business, and with the help of the financing she is able to increase her inventory and obtain customers. Her plans are to continue to improve her home and add a room for each one of her children so that they do not have to be always together and have more privacy. She will achieve this little by little for everything is expensive and she cannot add on all at once.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, electric appliances to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Sara Antonia

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Antonia C. R. tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que tiene de realizar por mas de 13 años,  es madre de 2 hijos los que estudian en centros educativos publicos del municipio de Las Trojes.
Con las ganancias que le genera este negocio apoya a su esposo y asi juntos sacan adelante su familia y su hogar, gracias a la buena administracion y al buen manejo de su negocio a logrado todo lo que hoy en dia posee , los precios modicos que ofrece Sara a sus clientes hacen que ella tenga una buena clientela. .
solicita el credito para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca navideña donde muchas personas compran ropa para regalar a sus seres queridos y Sara desea tener un buen surtido para satisfacer a su apreciable clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Antonia C. R. has been selling clothes and shoes for more than 13 years. She is the mother of two children who attend public schools in the town of Las Trojes.

With the earnings her business generates, she is able to help her husband with moving their family forward. Thanks to the good administration and management of her business, Sara has achieved everything she has today. She has developed a good clientele as a result of the modest prices she offers.

Sara is requesting a loan to restock her business since the Christmas season is approaching. Many people buy clothes for their loved ones during this time, so she wants to have a good assortment to satisfy her valued customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell for the holiday season

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
el sr. Joel G. C. se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, cremas, zapatos, pastillas tambien vende pan, churros y refrescos, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado su negocio, el tomo la decision de montar su propio negocio ya que la situacion en este pais es dificil y no se encuentran trabajos en empresas privadas ni publicas, ahora el esta empezando poco a poco a surtir su negocio pero necesita capital para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder hacerlo crecer, es por esta razon que el esta solicitando el credito.
es casado y tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Joel G. C. sells children's clothing, shoes, pills, creams, bread, churros, and soft-drinks. Not too long ago, he made the decision to start his own business now that the situation in the country is difficult and there aren't jobs to be found in either public or private businesses. He is beginning to expand his business little by little, but he needs money to be able to buy more merchandise so that it can grow. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan. Mr. C. is married with children.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Darlin Nohemi

texts.es:
la Joven Darlin Nohemi C.  se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de articulos de plastico para el hogar, tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, esta casada no tiene hijos toda via.
Con los ingresos que su negocio le genera apoya con algunos gastos en el hogar a su conyugue, 
uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda en la que pueda emplear personas y de esta forma contribuir a crear fuentes de empleo, Darlin dice que hay que buscar nuevas alternativas para poder salir adelante, es una mujer con un espiritu de superacion.
texts.en:
Darlin Nohemi C. works in trade and has a small business that sells plastic items for the home. She has been in this line of work for more than three years and during this time it has gone very well for her. She is married but has no children. With the income her business generates, she is able support her spouse with some of their household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a big store where she can employ people and thus help create sources of employment. Darlin believes that there are new ways to get ahead and is a woman with a strong spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corduroy, buckets, baskets, and clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jissela Rosibel

texts.es:
la joven JISSELA ROSIBEL L. A. tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos Hijos, hace un año ella inicio con su negocio, su actividad principal es la venta de cosmeticos, Jissela tomo la desición de dedicarse al comercio por que su compañero de hogar migro hacia los EE.UU en busca 
de mejorar sus condiciones de vida,  quedo sola y retorno al hogar de sus padres quienes se hicieron 
cargo de apoyarla en todo lo que ella necesitaba.
nos comenta que en su negocio le ha ido muy bién, ya que con los ingresos que le genera el mismo cubre
a un 100% sus gastos personales y de sus hijos, sus padres le estan brindando el apoyo con sus hijos, desde que inicio con su negocio su condición de vida ha mejorado y su sueño es instalar en un local  propio. desea brindarles todo lo que sus hijos necesiten, y es por esta razón que ella esta solicitando el creito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jissela Rosibel L. A. is a 21-year-old single mother with two children. She started her business a year ago which primarily sells cosmetics. Jissela decided to go into this line of work because her roommate moved to the United States in search of improving her living conditions. Jissela was left alone so she returned to her parents' home where they supported her with all that she needed. Her new business has gone very well, and the income she generates covers 100% of her personal expenses, but her parents still help support her children. Since she began her business her life quality has improved and she dreams of setting up in her own place. She wants to be able to provide her children with everything they need, and that is why she is asking for a loan so she can get back on her feet.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy creams, deodorant, lipstick, perfume, powders, eyeshadow, and facial treatments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Hilaria es primaria completa y tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda bien implementada en su casa para así ya no ir al mercado.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad de las demás socias
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the "3 de mayo" ("May 3rd") Communal Bank and lives in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department, Peru. She is 50 years old and married, and works buying and selling basic grains and grocery items. She has completed primary school, and has four children. Hilaria has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past four years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles, and she used it to buy more merchandise. She is currently requesting a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles to buy dry goods like rice, sugar, pasta, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own fully stocked store at home, so that she doesn't have to go out to sell at the market. Her favorite part of her Communal Bank is her savings account, and the fact that her fellow group members are always punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, pasta and eggs

loans.name: Rubertina Liucadia

texts.es:
La señora Rubertina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 2 años, del distrito, provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió hasta primaria incompleta, tiene su tienda de abarrotes.

Rubertina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, huevos.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
For two years Señora Rubertina has been partner in the Communal Bank "Las Kantutas" in the district and province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old and lives with her partner but they don't have children. She did not complete elementary school. She has a grocery store. Rubertina tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for 300.00 nuevos soles, she was be able to increase her working capital to buy rice, sugar and noodles. She will seek a loan of 2200.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy merchandise like: sugar, rice, noodles and eggs. Her dream for the future is to have her own car. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, eggs

loans.name: Martha Lizeth

texts.es:
la Joven. MARTHA LIZETH A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio denominado "MARTHA's BOUTIQUE" tiene mas 2 años dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo
este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres a los que apoya  con algunos gastos en el hogar.
Actualmente es pasante universitaria en la carrera de Pedagogia a la que asiste a distancia los fines de semana, es una muchacha emprendedora con deseos de superacion, en su negocio tiene un bonito surtido de prendas a la moda y a un buen precio. 
nos solicita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada de mayor venta del año.
su meta a corto plazo es poder graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
The young lady MARTHA LIZETH A. is an entrepreneur. She has a small business called “MARTHA’S BOUTIQUE”. She has been working in this business for the last 2 years, and during this time, it’s done very well. She is single, with no children, and lives with her parents whom she helps with some of the household expenses. Currently she is a student pending graduation at the university. She studies Education online on the weekends. She is a hardworking girl with the goals of getting ahead. In her business she has a nice assortment of stylish clothing at a good price. She is asking for a loan to stock up more for her business since this is the season of the highest sales of the year. Her aim is to graduate from the university in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and men, hangers, pony tail holders, and cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 56 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales. La señora Juana no tiene estudios y tiene 5 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región. Los comprará al por mayor.


Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y la alegría que hay entre las socias.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Communal Bank “Manuelas of today II.” She lives in the district of Ilave, part of the province El Collao in the Puno region of Peru. She is 56 years old and is married with five children. Juana buys and sells grain. She hasn’t had formal education.

Juana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan was 300 Peruvian soles to buy grain. She is asking for a loan of 800 Peruvian soles to invest in the wholesale purchase of regional staples.

What she likes the most about her organization are the meetings and the happiness that exists between members.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes beans and barley

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El joven Julio A. tiene 25 años de edad. Vive en el Caserío La Joya del distrito de Santiago en casa de su madre junto a su esposa y su menor hijo de dos años. Actualmente se dedica a labores de campo en parcelas y fundos de la zona de manera informal, además desempeña actividades de músico eventualmente los fines de semana o para festividades de la municipalidad de los distritos aledaños contando con instrumento propio. Su esposa lo apoya por temporadas de trabajo como obrera de campo. Necesitan apoyo para poder mejorar el lugar en donde viven ya que el espacio cedido por su madre es de adobe y caña.Su sueño es logar mejorar sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia.Son personas jóvenes que desean progresar con mucho esfuerzo.Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le podamos brindar a través de diversos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Julio A. is 25 years old and lives in the La Joya neighborhood of Santiago. He lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in his mother's home. Currently, he works informally as a field hand for small and large farms in the area. He also uses his own instrument to perform music on the weekends and for municipal festivals in neighboring areas. His wife helps support them by working seasonally in the fields.

They need support to be able to improve their home, since the space provided by his mother is made of adobe and reeds. Their dream is to be able to improve their family's living conditions. They are young people who are making great efforts to get ahead, and they are both thankful for the help they can receive from loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ELIZABETH F. G. D. Z., tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria y  tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza D. vacas, a la venta D.  leche y elaboración D. quesos, quesillos y yogurt.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró alimentos para las vacas e insumos para la elaboración D. yogurt.
Con este crédito D. 2,000 nuevos soles comprará 1 vaca y alimento para vacas.
Ella sueña con aumentar el número D. su ganado y así poder vender mayor cantidad D. leche .
texts.en:
Mrs. MARIA ELIZABETH F. G. D. Z. is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district in the Trujillo province in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Simpre Adelante II” (Always Ahead II). She has finished school through her 5th year of secondary and has 4 children who are economically dependent on her. She raises cattle, sells milk and makes cheese and yogurt. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Solos she bought food for the cows and supplies to make yogurt. With this loan of 2000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy 1 cow and food for the cows. Her dream is to increase the size of her herd and in this way she will be able to sell more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one additional cow and fodder for the entire herd

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es:
La señora MARITZA ELENA B. B., tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. MARITZA se dedica a la confección de zapatos y sandalias para damas y caballeros.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pegamento, cuero, plantillas, hilos, hebillas, etc. para la confección del calzado.
Con su próximo crédito de 100.00 nuevos soles comprará plantillas  al por mayor.
Ella sueña con confeccionar y vender mas calzado para así generar mayores ganancias y  seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. MARITZA ELENA B. B. is 46 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Creative Little Seeds). The business woman completed school through the 5th year of secondary and has 2 children who are economically dependent on her. Maritza makes shoes and sandals for men and women. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought glue, leather, insoles, thread, buckles etc. for the construction of footwear. With her next loan of 100.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy insoles for the most part. She hopes to make and sell more footwear and in this way generate more income and continue to help her children in their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insoles for shoemaking

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
la sra Adela M. se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, compra los panes a diferentes productores y los vende en su tienda, este pan se le vende muy rapido todos los dias porque tiene muy buen sabor y es bajo en su precio, todo el pan que compra se vende en el mismo dia, tiene muchos clientes.
estando ahi nosotros con ella nos regalo una bandeja de pastelitos de piña y si saben muy bien.
Adela desea el credito para poder invertirlo en mas pan, ya que a veces se queda corta con las ventas y el producto se le termina rapido.
nos comento que esta muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada vez mas. su meta es poder construir una area de atencion a sus clientes que sea mas grande y tener varios estantes en donde guardar el pan para poder darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes y que su producto este bien ordenado y guardado.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela M. sells sweet bread, which she buys from different producers to offer in her store. This type of bread sells very quickly every day because it tastes good and is inexpensive. Adela has many customers and all the bread she buys is sold on the same day. When we came to see her, she gave us a tray of miniature pineapple cakes which were very good.

Adela wants a loan so that she can invest in more bread. Sometimes her sales end abruptly because her product sells quickly. She says she is happy because her business is growing even more. Her goal is to build a service area for her customers that is larger and has several shelves on which to display the bread. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers and keep her products secure and well-organized.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweet bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Jeannette Z. mujer activa para el trabajo, con una pequeña pulpería, en donde vende una variedad de productos, y por las noches hace fritanga. Anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca producto que no le pagaban lo producido opto por renunciar y con su liquidación puso su pequeña venta,  para poder ganar un poco mas de dinero ya que tiene que cubrir los gastos básicos como: agua luz y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios para que tenga un nivel educativo mejor ya que por recursos económico de sus padres no estudio todo el ciclo.  Son dos hijos los q tiene pero la  mayor solo trabaja para poder cubrir sus necesidades ya que no le puede comprar lo suficiente, labora en una tienda de repuestos eléctricos. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y tiene un salario bajo, es por eso la necesidad de apoyarlo y poder saldar juntos los gastos. La inversión con este préstamo es poder  aumentar las ventas comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, café, gaseosa, golosinas, queso, entre otros para poder vender mas. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa ya que es pequeña y muy sencilla. Reconoce que solo mediante el financiamiento ha podido aumentar el inventario de su negocio ya que es a un plazo accesible para pagar la cuota.
texts.en:
Jeannette Z. is an active hardworking woman who has a small grocery store where she sells a variety of products and in the evenings sells fried foods. Previously she worked in the free trade zone but they did not pay well and so she opted to quit and with her severance pay she started her small business. She did this to earn a bit more money, since she has to cover basic expenses such as water, light, and helping her son with his studies so that he can reach a higher educational level, since his parents did not finish their education due to a lack of resources. She has two children. The oldest works in a store selling electrical parts to cover his own expenses, although he does not always earn enough. Her husband works as a security guard and has a low salary, so she needs to support him so that they can pay off the bills together. This loan will be used to increase her sales by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, corn, coffee, soft drinks, candy, cheese and other products to sell. She plans to continue improving her house, since it is small and very simple. She recognizes that only through this financing can she increase her business inventory, since the loan has terms that are affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cheese, corn, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other items to increase her sales

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 8 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella tiene estudios (secundaria completa), se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Doris nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar lana.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar lanas de todo tipo y todos los insumos para hacer las artesanías.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Doris, 49, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank, which is located in the district and province of Puno, Puno department, for the last 8 years. She is a single mother of two children. She finished secondary schools and sells handicrafts. Doris tells us that with her initial, 300 sol, loan from Manueal Ramos Movement she bought wool. She now requests a 3000 new sol loan which will be used to buy all kinds of wool and raw materials for her crafts. Her dream for the future is to have her own crafts store and that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings and the gatherings with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Martha Odili

texts.es: La señora Martha C. a sus 49 años de edad tiene la visión abierta al aumento en la productividad de su negocio, de alcanzar sus metas y objetivos, desde muy joven trabajo por cuenta propia y a la actualidad estableció su venta de productos de abarrotes y otros, tener un mejor patrimonio para dejar a sus hijos y nietos es unas de su metas poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que le falta el repello, pintura para darle una presentación mejor, la otra es el crecimiento y ampliación de su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua en el cual el peligro es constante. Inicio el negocio para tener su propio ingreso y así satisfacer las necesidades que pasa en el hogar se ha encontrado en el camino dificultades de falta de capital para aumentar inventario. Con el financiamiento que la institución le ha otorgado comprara productos para el negocio como: granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosa, productos enlatados para mejorar las ventas. A corto plazo desea comprar vitrinas para vender mejor el servicio a si como dar hacer estantes adecuado para la venta ya que la tiene con unas tablas, pero con mucho deseo de poder hacer todos estos cambio que esta logrando con este financiamiento el cual da las gracias por el apoyo al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha C. is 49 years old and open to increasing the productivity of her business, as well as achieving her goals and objectives. Ever since she was young woman, Martha has worked for herself and currently operates a store that sells groceries and other products. She now has assets that she can leave to her children and grandchildren. One of her goals is to finish making improvements to her home. She needs to plaster and paint the walls of her house to give it a nicer appearance. Another goal is to grow and expand her business so that she can generate better revenues. Martha lives in one of the poor neighborhoods of Managua where danger is ever present.

She started this business so that she could have her own income and satisfy the necessities of her household. When she encounters difficulties along the way, she lacks the capital to increase her inventory. With this loan from AFODENIC, she will buy products for her business such as basic grains, candy, sodas, and canned goods in order to improve her sales. In the short term, she wants to buy display cases for her store so that she can provide better service. This addition will provide adequate shelving along with the tables she already owns for displaying products. Martha desires to accomplish everything, and she can make these changes because loans are available to support small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao; ella tiene 40 años D. edad, está casada, tiene 03 hijos, los cuales viven con ella. Estudió secundaria incompleta. 
Juliana trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 04 años; tiene diferentes negocios como: compra y venta D. productos D. la región, compra y venta D. prendas D. vestir y a la compra y venta D. queso(venD. en Arequipa e Ilave).
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró chuño, papas y queso, los que vendió en Arequipa.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar un toro y el resto lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. la región.
Su visión hacia el futuro es ser mayorista y tener un sitio fijo en Arequipa para poder vender sus productos.
Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el préstamo con bajo interés y las charlas con las socias.
texts.en:
Juliana, 40, is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank, which is located in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province. She is married and the mother of three children who are still dependent on her. She finished secondary school. Juliana has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 4 years. She has different business activities like: buying and selling regional products, buying and selling clothing, and buying and selling cheese (she sells in Arequipa and Ilave). She tells us that her first loan was for 300 new soles. She bought chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), potatoes and cheese that she sold in Arequipa. She is requesting 3000 new soles to buy a bull; any remainder she will use to buy regional products. Her vision for the future is to be a wholesaler and have a fixed locale in Arequipa to sell her products. What she likes most about her communal bank is the low-interest loans and the talks with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es viuda. Se dedica a la compra y venta de golocinas. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Brigida es secundaria completa y tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de golosinas como: galletas, caramelos, chocolates, yogures, etc..

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros, los préstamos y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Brigida, 47, is a member of the "3 de Mayo" communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a widow and is a sweets merchant. She finished secondary school and has two children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy stock inventory for her business. She is now requesting 1000 new soles to buy sweets such as: cookies, candies, chocolates, yoghurt, etc. Her future desire is to have a grocery store and that her children become professionals. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the savings and the get-togethers with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, yoghurt, candies, etc.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 7 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudio hasta superior completa, se dedica a compra y venta de hortalizas.

Marleny nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar verduras.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería como: cebolla zanahoria, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su capital propio y poder ejercer su profesión..

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana.
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank for 7 years. She lives in the district and province of Puno, Puno department. She is a single mother of a son. She completed higher education and she is a vegetable merchant. Marleny relates that her first, 300 sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy vegetables. She now is requesting 800 new soles to buy more merchandise like: onions, carrots, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own capital and be able to work in her profession. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the savings she gets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Ana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a  la compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora Ana estudió secundaria completa y  tiene 5 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones entre las socias
texts.en:
Ana, 50, is a member of the "24 de Junio" communal bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is married, has 5 children, and finished secondary school. She raises small farm animals for sale. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3 years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy animals. She now requests 1700 new soles to buy a bull. Her wish for the future is to have her own house in Ilave. What she likes best about her organization are the get-togethers with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 8 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudio hasta secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

Vilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar ovejas y porcinos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar dos toros.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa  propia y dos propiedades para poder criar ahí sus ganados.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros
texts.en:
Vilma, 41, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank for 8 years. She is from the district and province of Puno, Puno department. She is married and has two children. She completed secondary school and raises cattle for sale. Vilma relates that her first, 300 sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy pigs and sheep. She now requests 3000 new soles to buy two bulls. Her dream for the future is to have her own house and two pieces of property on which to raise her cattle. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bulls.

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es:
Laura  es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, es  madre de un hijo menor de edad. Laura se dedica a la  venta de tablas y listones de madera, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en prendas de vestir.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles que será utilizado para comprar madera y venderlo posteriormente a sus clientes. La meta de Laura es tener una tienda de calzados y prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking woman who fights for her ideals. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and the mother of a minor child. Laura sells wooden planks and strips for a living with her husband. The business operates in her house. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres perserverantes II" for two years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which allowed her to invest in clothing. At present she needs a loan of 800 soles which will be used to purchase wood and later sell it to her customers. Laura's goal is to have a men's and women's shoe and clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase wood and sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora Elsa no estudió y tiene 6 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado ovino y porcino.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar un terreno en Camaná y ahí criar sus vacas lecheras.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa is a member of the communal bank "Manuelas de hoy II." She lives in the Ilave district of El Collao province in the Puno region. She is 47 years old and is married. She has six children. She didn't go to school.

Señora Elsa buys and sells small farm animals. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (a Peruvian women's organization) for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy sheep and pigs. She needs a loan of 1700 PEN to purchase a bull. Her wish for the future is to buy a plot of land in Camaná and raise dairy cattle there.

The savings accounts and the meetings with other members are the things she likes most about her organization.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Roger Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Roger José Gutiérrez O., Labora como conductor de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, el tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido  3 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del piso de su  vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Roger José Gutiérrez O. works as a driver for the National University of Engineering. He has three children, two of whom are of school age. Roger is single.

During the three years he has worked with CEPRODEL, Roger used his previous three loans to invest in home improvements. He is an excellent client. The loan he is now requesting will be used to buy construction materials for refurbishing his floor and to pay for labor. This will provide better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor needed to refurbish his floors

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: La señora Teresita G. es casada con el señor Juan Enrique Moreno Quiroz y son padres de familia de 2 niñas, son propietarios de 2 diferentes negocios uno de abarrotes establecido desde hace 9 años de nombre “Abarrotes Paola “ y otro de la venta de barbacoa los días viernes, sábados y domingos. Negocios muy bien establecidos ya que son personas muy dedicadas y trabajadoras. Están tramitando este crédito para la instalación correcta del cableado en el área del negocio de abarrotes y acabados interiores de su vivienda, para asi ofrecer un mejor ambiente y una mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita G. is married to Sr. Juan Enrique Moreno Quiroz and both are the parents of their two daughters. They own and operate two different businesses. One is a grocery store they started nine years ago called “Abarrotes Paola”. The other business involves selling barbecue on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. These businesses are well-established because they are dedicated and hardworking people.

Teresita is requesting this loan to install proper wiring in her grocery store and to finish the interior of her house, which will provide a better and more comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install electrical wiring in her store & finish the interior of her house

loans.name: Brenda Veronica

texts.es: La señora Brenda Verónica es casada con el señor Héctor Rubén desde hace 14 años, y son padres de familia de 2 niñas ella labora para una casa  dándole mantenimiento y su esposo trabaja para una empresa, ellos como una familia joven, trabajadora  y muy responsable están tramitando este crédito para la colocación del vitropiso de su hogar para una vista diferente y se sientan mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda Verónica has been married to Señor Héctor Rubén for 14 years and they are the parents of two daughters. She works as a housekeeper and her husband works for a company. They are a young family that is hardworking and very responsible. They are taking out this loan to put tile in their home to improve its appearance and make them more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for tilework

loans.name: Obed

texts.es: El joven Obed Ramírez Barragán es empresario de un negocio de giro imprenta, diseños de pagina etc. De nombre “Red House “establecido desde hace 3 años, el tiene aun mas proyectos de los que ya ha realizado, y por tal motivo el esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión de nuevos diseños para ofrecerles a sus clientes, ya que los prefieren por su gran calidad y excelencia.
texts.en:
The young Obed Ramírez Barragán has a business that specializes in printing and print design. The business, of the name "Red House," was established 3 years ago. He now has even more projects than he has yet completed, and for this reason he is requesting this loan to invest in new designs to offer to his customers, who prefer him for his high quality and overall excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in his printing and design business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Cesar S. U., Labora como responsable de mantenimiento y limpieza en el Mercado Israel Lewites, el tiene a su cargo un hijos, este se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido  4 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar S. U., works in cleaning and maintenance at the Israel Lewite Market (Mercado Israel Lewite). He has one school age son. He is single and has had loans with CEPRODEL for 3 years. In this period of time, he has invested 4 loans in making improvements to his home, with help from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The requested loan is to invest in the purchase of materials for remodeling his home’s roof and to pay for the labor, in order to give his son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of construction materials and the labor costs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
A widow from Barangay Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental is the featured micro-entrepreneur. She is Mrs. Isabel B. who is 54 years old with three children. These days she is alone in the house because all her children have their own families now.

To support herself, Isabel engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store in her home and a dressmaking activity. This business has been in existence for almost twenty-five years already. She earns an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month which is sufficient only for her basic needs. She also receives a little share from a parcel of land, being the caretaker.

Isabel is a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC. She joined Paglaum MPC because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.


This time Isabel is given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P4,000 to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and for her goods to be displayed during market day in their barangay. She is very thankful to Paglaum MPC for the trust given to her as a new member.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. C., a sari-sari (variety) store owner, snack vendor, and mother of five children, is posed with her goods displayed during their market day in Barangay Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, her beloved place.

Vicenta is married to Gilbert D. C., a farmer and laborer in their local community. With regards to their family income, Vicenta felt some hardships and economic crises so she decided to open up a sari-sari store twenty-nine years ago to help her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. She earns an average net income of not less than P2,500 a month from her business activity.

Vicenta is a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC. She joined Paglaum MPC a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

As a new member, Vicenta is given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P4,500 to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and snack vending activity. The future income from this loan will be used for the loan repayments and for savings for her children’s educational expenses needed in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ivette Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Ivette G. L. de 37 años de edad vive en Botijeria Angulo Norte - Cercado de Ica. Vive en casa de un familiar junto con sus 2 hijos uno de 18 años y la mujer de 16 años de edad .
Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas,pollos brosthers, gaseosas y otros.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado fuera de su domicilio, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años.
